Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value. A sweet hotel nestled away”
Reviews.Author: BreashearsDesign
Reviews.Content: A very clean, comfortable hotel nestled in a side street, just around the corner from a tree lined square. It's close to the subway, excellent restaurants and major attractions. The beds are very comfortable and the price can't be beat. They book up to six months in advance during peak travel so plan ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: MyDearWatsonAu
Reviews.Content: For location and value this place is very good. We stayed in a family room with 2 double beds overlooking the street. The room was clean and there was a small but functional bathroom in the room. The neighborhood is great for walking and close to public transport for seeing the sights. We'd recommend it. We didn't have their breakfast though, as there were many cafes nearby with breakfast for a lesser price and with better street views.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Eric B
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on the Rick Steve's 2012 France guide and we were very glad we did. Location is perfect as motioned on previous reviews and a short walk from the subway station. The rooms are decorated in a unique manner, beds are very comfortable as well as the pillows. Our room had a radiator and kept us pretty warm since it was cold in March, and we did not experience any street noise. Ask for a 1st floor (2nd floor in the US) room and you will get the free wifi from the lobby in your room. Do yourself a favor and try all the bakeries on Rivoli street as well as the artisan charcutier on the corner with Birague... Awesome food indeed...I'm hungry now. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: grizzy121
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly situated for visiting the major galleries and Notre Dame, all within easy walking distance. Also the Taxi Boats stop at Hotel de Ville was ideal for travelling to the Eiffel side of the city. There is a small square around the corner with various cafes. Also the "Pure Malt" Scots bar, run by an Aberdonian, is just off the square and is reasonably priced. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from the St Paul metro station. The hotel has a lot of character with the staff being friendly and helpful. Likely to return to this hotel if returning to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great value and great location.”
Reviews.Author: avd59
Reviews.Content: Would recommend it, would stay there again and thing it's a great small hotel. Alittle noisy at night from the street but overall I believe it's a great value.

Reviews.Title: “A small cozy place in the Marais”
Reviews.Author: katizza
Reviews.Content: The hotel has small rooms with private bathroom. We had a room on the top floor (elevator!!!) overlooking the parisian roofs. The hotel is very well located and it's excellent value. The mattresses were quite soft. if you only stay for the weekend it's great The room was clean, has a TV, and you don;t hear the noise from the street. At the reception you can use internet. Considering the average prices in Paris, i'd say this is an excellent find. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: katelilybee
Reviews.Content: Stayed in family room here. Location is excellent - I love this part of Paris and it's so central. Staff at the hotel were really helpful and very friendly. We thought the breakfast seemed expensive and went to cafe round the corner, but actually ended up spending just as much - so the next day we had breakfast at the Jeanne d'Arc which was much better than I expected - typical French breakfast (bread, jam, croissants, pain au chocolate and coffee). It was also surprisingly quiet with the windows shut - we opened them late one night and realised it was actually quite noisy outside! Would thoroughly recommend the Jeanne d'Arc - central, friendly, clean and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: NorthumberlandRosie
Reviews.Content: I'd last stayed here in the 1980s, and had fond memories of it, but a long time had passed, so I wasn't sure how it'd be. But we loved it - simple, friendly, a bit whacky, and wonderfully positioned. Room and showerroom both pretty compact, but comfortable. Breakfast was variable, but overall, good value at 8 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Irish C
Reviews.Content: Spent a very pleasant couple of days here. The hotel decor is a little out of date and we didnt have breakfast there, but the room was very nice (wooden beams) and the staff were pleasant. I would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, nice area.”
Reviews.Author: klompen
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel with friendly staff in the Marais area. We paid about 100 Euros for the room with tiny but nice hot shower. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: heragirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good value and in a great location near Place des Vosges in the beautiful Marais-walking distance to Notre Dame, left bank, and easy Metro access to everywhere else.Room was small but quiet and clean. Breakfast was good with the exception of the coffee(tasted boiled), but there are plenty of cafes in the area for a good " cafe au lait" .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff and lots of charm”
Reviews.Author: ColourOfAbsence
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights on our last trip to Paris, and loved it! If you are not looking for big hotel comforts, and like to go for a smaller hotel with some charm, then Hotel Jeanne d'Arc is perfect. We stayed in room 12, which was on the second (for north americans, first for the French) floor. The room was quite big by European standards, and compared to some of the other hotels we've stayed in before. Nice, bright bathroom that faced the street with a window. Bed was sufficiently comfortable. Even on the second floor, noise was not an issue as the hotel is not on a main street. There is a small elevator in the hotel if you need one. We didn't take the breakfast the hotel offered for an additional fee, instead we went to a near by boulangerie every morning. All of the staff members we've encountered were warm and courteous. You can eat take out food in the breakfast area, which is a bonus. The location is great! in the centre of Le Marais (in the 4th arrondisment), steps away from sights, restaurants, shops. My favourite part was being able to walk to Ile St Louis and the Ile de la Cite in 10 minutes. The metro St Paul is just a few minutes away and will connect you easily if you are taking the RER and switching to the metro. We are returning to Hotel Jeanne d'Arc again in May and would recommend this to anyone visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MartaC
Reviews.Content: May I start by saying this is now my favourite hotel in Paris? It's not the best, for sure, but if you're looking for a not-too-expensive well located hotel which still manages to be charming and atmospheric, then look no further. The location is wonderful. I particularly like the area (Le Marais) itself - galleries, restaurants, bars, shops, historic streets, the beautiful Place des Vosges and the Jewish heritage all there - but if you'd like to visit other parts of Paris, the metro station St. Paul is a short walk away and connects you to, well, everywhere in town. Breakfast is OK, nothing much but enough to start the day, but the staff is really nice and helpful. The room was big (I stayed in room 33), others looked smaller from the plan. The bathroom is just average, not big, but clean. Fine enough by me. While central, I found the hotel really quiet - no noise from the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: GoGirlGoGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in Dec 2001 - what a charming place. We were able to walk to Bastille and St. Paul Metro. Lots of wonderful places to eat and shop nearby. Staff was helpful and friendly. They had a hairdryer I could use, because I didn't pack my own. We stayed on the top floor and the elevator was tiny, only held 1 person and suitcase, but it was very quaint. Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “I love this charming Hotel in Paris, Le Marais”
Reviews.Author: samsarah49
Reviews.Content: To stay at Hotel Jeanne-d'Arc is like staying at home with my family. Le Marais (IVe) is the oldest part of Paris (Lutecia). I can walk safely in any street of the area and feel free to talk to people. The hotel is close to many charming boutiques, historical places, and dozens of different great restaurants. I specially enjoy the easiness of the people who work at the hotel. They care for their customers and make them feel at home. I am looking forward to my next visit in March 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Family-like Hotel, located in the Heart of Le Marais”
Reviews.Author: Muskote
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, very friendly Hotel in the Heart of Marais, we will always come back.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location - wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: csant
Reviews.Content: Just off saint paul metro within walking distance to le marais restaurants and bars; lovely place st catherine round the corner and place vosges within walking distance, yet still v quiet; the staff couldn't have been nicer; having said all this, the rooms are small especially the shower cubicles hence not ideal for everyone or else be patient!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families with teens!”
Reviews.Author: Islandpegger
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the summer of 2009 and it was fabulous! The hotel is historical but our room had a completely renovated awesomely modern bathroom with a great shower (bring your own shampoo, as I recall there was only one travel size for our whole stay, but, who cares!). Best of all, the room (which was on the main floor) was kind of divided in half, with a queen (double?) for my husband and I on one half, and then a wall dividing it from the other half of the room, which had two twin beds where our teenagers slept. Tons of great things close by to see and do. And the staff were very helpful. We speak some French and they very much appreciated our efforts to speak the language of the country. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Such a charming place”
Reviews.Author: otubo
Reviews.Content: Such a charming place. The hotel is a few minutes away from the subway and a Velib station. Has comfortable beds, delicious hot water in the bathtub and a gentle staff. Totally recomend it :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Osprey2011
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights at this hotel and had an excellent, satisfying experience. The room was spacious, clean, plenty of hot water with flat screen TV. They will be having wireless in each room soon. Excellent location,near metro(St.Paul) and many sights and restaurants. The staff was very kind, friendly and helpful. They speak English and were helpful in many ways: train schedules, potential strikes in France etc. At night , it can be noisy because of the location of the restaurants nearby but the windows are new and help shut out the sound. I would go back there anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: SteveFromBoulder
Reviews.Content: An unbeatable value. This is a very charming Parisian hotel, with clean, comfortable rooms, a great location, and very reasonable prices. The hotel is a 10-minute walk to the Metro (St-Paul), and a 5-minute walk to several great cafes & restaurants. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Overall, this is an ideal place to stay in the Marais.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Marcelleramalho
Reviews.Content: It isn't very cheap but worth every single euro. It's near a delicious coffee shop (Pauls), the oldest square in Paris (voges), the underground and Bastilla. It's neat and confortable. The breakfast isn't included.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a great price”
Reviews.Author: mariasgirl60
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this quaint but very cool hotel. Very close to the St Paul metro station and really in the heart of a vibrant and easy to navigate location, we really enjoyed our stay here. Our room was spacious and clean with a recently renovated bathroom. The hosts were friendly and helpful and breakfasts were ample. Loved the Place St. Catherine just behind which had a variety of excellent restaurants and lovely street entertainment during the day: a very pleasant way to eat your baguette at lunch time! One evening we had brought some cheese and wine, etc... to have for dinner (a little tired of dining out at one stage). The hosts allowed us to use the dining room and the utensils etc... from the kitchen - they were very kind. From here, we walked to Notre Dame, the Louvre, even the Eiffel Tower and the Champs-Elysees! The Picasso museum is not far and neither is place des Vosges or the Georges Pompidou centre. For us who enjoyed walking, it was great to be able to reach all these places. Also some great shopping along the main street. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location.”
Reviews.Author: no1hockeymom
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me several years ago. Location is great and convenient to a Metro stop. We were a group of 3 and had a pleasantly large room. It was clean and it looked like there had been a few updates. There is a tub and shower head but the one in our room was only hand held but the water pressure was great and after figuring out a routine it was fine. There was free wifi in the lobby but unfortunately not in the rooms. There is a small lift if you require it especially for getting luggage up stairs. After the first day we had the breakfast and were very satisfied with it. It allowed us to hit the streets running and not worry about finding breakfast after. The lady on when we checked in was very friendly and helpful though I found there was a variation in this area with one gentleman in the evening being somewhat indifferent as he was busy on personal calls 2 nights in a row. I would definately consider this hotel again and found it to be good value for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small room”
Reviews.Author: Remmyf
Reviews.Content: The location was fabulous and very easy to get to from the metro. Very young, hip, and fun area with lots of great restaurants to eat at. The hotel itself was alright. It was very very clean which is commendable. Although the hotel was small, which is pretty standard I suppose for a European hotel. The bathroom was quite cramped though, but fresh towels were provided and room was always cleaned. The shower didn't have a door, so water got everywhere on the floor. When we arrived to the hotel, we weren't really greeted I just told him my name and he handed me a key. Which I thought was weird. Another thing that bothered me, but I got used to, was that they asked us to give them they key back every time we left the hotel. I felt uncomfortable with it at first, but understood why later on the trip. They aren't there to sneak into your rooms, they want to prevent strangers from coming into the hotel. So overall, it was a great stay, awesome location, but small room. I would stay there again anyways and would def recommend! I can't comment in the breakfast, bc we never ate it but we saw some guests munching away.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: CherylGrrl
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the value of this hotel, although the rooms were "European style" (old, funky, no kleenex, no toiletries, worn linens, old carpet, no AC, etc.) I would not recommend staying here in the summer as it was in the 60's most days and could get really warm in our room on the 4th floor. We had to open the windows at night and use a fan to sleep comfortably. Still, the location near the St. Paul metro stop was very convenient for traveling anywhere in the city, and a short walk to Notre Dame. The person at the front desk (we met 3 of them) was always cheerful and helpful. Skip the breakfast at 8 Euros at go to the Starbucks just a couple blocks away on the Rue du Rivoli instead for a better food selection and at less cost -- and they take credit cards for even the smallest purchase. Much cheaper than other hotels in the area, and there were about a half dozen moderately priced cafes in a square just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Again”
Reviews.Author: ceach
Reviews.Content: Returned to this hotel 3 years after first visit. This hotel is all about location walking distance from the louvre, notre dame, the bastille and two metro stations(St Paul & The Bastille) very near.Being in the heart of the Marais there is always something going on. The staff in the hotel are very friendly and helpful even if you don't speak French.Rooms are clean and comfortable. A charming hotel in the best area of Paris with some fab Bistros and restuarants right on your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: GeoChris1966
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, near the metro station and about 1200 meters from the church of Notre Damme. We stayed at a 2 double bed/4persons room (the whole family together) and our stay was very good the room and the hotel was clean, although there was no A/C and no mini-refrigerator, also the bathroom was clean although it was small. The stuff was very friendly and all spoke English (thank god because my French are very bad!!!). The price (162 €/day) was very good for a hotel in the center of Paris - hence the great value for money but breakfast was an extra 9€/person (optional). It is possible to book from the internet and also to ask for explanations using the hotels website and email. I recommend this hotel to all fellow tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service and large rooms”
Reviews.Author: hotelrmy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice originally on a recommendation from a friend. The first time was in January 2011 and the second in May 2011. The first with my husband and the second with a friend. I would say that during summer, the rooms can get extremely hot as there is no A/C but of course this did not bother us in January. Both times the rooms were on the top floor and both quite large given normal Parisian standards. One in particular had a lovely view over the roof tops of Paris! The rooms have quirky little touches and the hotel as well has a quirky bohemian feel, very relaxing and a nice place to come back to after a long day walking the streets of Paris. We always found the staff very helpful especially given my schoolgirl french and therefore english was mainly used. They helped us out booking restaurants as well as generally assisting with any queries we had. The free WIFI in the hotel is also a bonus, just ask and they will give you the code. I am a very light sleeper and both times I stayed I was woken up with noisy next door neighbours. The lady was so loud on the second visit that when she came in at 12:30am at night she was extremely inconsiderate to her neighbours as I am sure the whole floor would have heard her. And the banging of the doors that is mentioned in previous reviews also rings true. I would suggest if you are a light sleeper to bring ear plugs. Besides these problems, the hotel is in a truly fantastic location in the Marais, with a gorgeous courtyard filled with restaurants a minute away and the wonderful shops of the Marais and St Paul antique markets nearby. St Pauls Metro is only a 5 minute walk. On our second trip the main metro to get to the hotel from Gard Du Nord was being refurbished, so it was a bit of a hike with bags from the other metro line we had to catch , but hopefully this may now be fixed. The atmosphere in the Marais is second to none and I would not bother with breakfast as there are so many great patiserries/cafes to grab some delicious Parisian pastries and a coffee. There are also some great cheese shops about 5 minutes from the hotel as well as a supermarket if you need it. All in all I would definitely stay at Jeanne D'Arc again and again as for the price, the relaxing and welcoming bohemian feel of the hotel, great service & the brilliant location, it is second to none. Plus the money you save on your rooms you can spend in the shops or on a gorgeous meal out ! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: TXN60613
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Jeanne d'Arc on the advice of a friend who has repeatedly stayed here. We were a little nervous when booking, but the price and location were right on, so we took a chance -- and I'm so glad we did. Booking and confirming this hotel was extremely easy - we asked for an earlier check in and it was granted with no issues. The photos on this site of the hotel are spot on, which is why I am not uploading any additional photos. We stayed in room 45 which was equipped with an armoire to store our clothes, a small desk and a TV. The queen size bed was quite comfortable, although it did sag a bit in the middle (noticeable from outside the bed, but once in you couldn't tell at all). The bathroom was small, but it looked recently remodeled and it had a shower (no bathtub, which is preferable for us, although some rooms did have baths). We took multiple showers a day (as it was hot in Paris when we were there and we were doing a lot of walking) and there was always hot water and great water pressure - even by US standards. The view from our room was of the other rooms in the hotel (interior ventilation), which wasn't ideal, but was perfectly fine -- we had no intention of sitting in the hotel room and looking at the sights of Paris, we wanted to get out and really see them. The interior window also cut down on the street noise. I am a light sleeper and I heard no street noise or noise from other rooms or the hallways in the hotel. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, because there were so many great pastry shops in the neighborhood. While this hotel was great, there were a few things I didn't care for. When we dropped our luggage off before our room was ready, the woman at the front desk just left them in the lobby and not in the luggage room - nothing was stolen but it was a bit unsettling. When using the shower the entire bathroom got drenched. The shower curtain didn't quite go all the way to the base of the tub so it was a mess once you were finished showering. The real question: Would I stay here again on my next trip to Paris: WITHOUT A DOUBT. The price was excellent, the beds were comfy, the rooms were adequate and the location was absolutely perfect. If you are looking for a nice little hotel in Paris near EVERYTHING this is the one for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: vitaestdecorus13
Reviews.Content: A charming budget hotel, good location, close to public transport and most monuments(close to bus & metro station/shops/supermarket/river Seine/plenty of restaurants-4th Arr.) Our room was very small/tiny,no balcony,breakfast is very basic (jam+butter on bread+coffe/tea.Price per night is overpriced for an average budget hotel and average service.(but I guess that's Paris standard). The bathroom tub was not cleaned properly, when we were there. 24hrs desk frontdesk service is excellent and very helpfull. Free internet access. Overall stayed happy there without any problems. Good for limited budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: AdrianJones91
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 years ago and the place has been given a facelift. Excellent value (Paris is so expensive for everything) and great location. Downside is no A/C. It was 32C yesterday and we had to shut the windows at night because of the constant noise. Internally the hotel is noisey, very fierce closers on the doors and all the plumbing seemed to be routed through our room. However, I suspect you could pay a lot more and have similar problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, so-so service”
Reviews.Author: MisterPip
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. The room was small with a lovely roof top view and very clean but limited in the way of amenities (luckily it did have a fan as it was a steamy part of August). Access to the room was by way of a tiny lift which often seemed to be on August vacation, so there was a bit of stair pounding. The staff were OK but some were not overly helpful. The biggest gripe was that the wifi service was out for most of the time we were there, and we were not able to use the standard internet service which was still working. Overall, it was good value for money for Paris and a great location, but I wouldn't rush back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect....for the price !”
Reviews.Author: davlynski
Reviews.Content: Great position in the Marais. Our room (No40) was not too small, and had a bit of an outlook. Just step out the door to around 8 restaurants (Les Bougresses our favourite). Stefan (manager?) was extremely helpful....and patient (we heard some guests asking ridiculous questions). Breakfasts were pretty basic for the price, but we always prefer breakfast "in", rather than go out. Free WiFi downstairs (very slow), and there is a guest computer and printer as well. This is a great area of Paris. We stayed for 7 nights, and for under 100 Euro a night it is amazing value

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ladylimerick
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights on a city break. We loved coming back after a day's sightseeing, freshening up, and walking only a few yards to the lovely square of beautiful and reasonable French restaurants. Close to Metro, quiet and cosy, we'll stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing could have been better”
Reviews.Author: SHOGara
Reviews.Content: On this, our first trip to Paris, we wanted to reside in the Marais our first three nights. Recommended to me by a dear friend and former professor, whose love of Paris exceeds all but that for his family, we were delighted when a vacancy came open and we were able to book. We were not disappointed. Permitted to enter our room early, we found it comfortable by expectation, with a view of the fountain outside our window. The streets in this part of the city are remarkably quiet, but there is much life in St. Catherine's Square, nearly adjacent the hotel. Cafes abut one another, and the atmosphere is entirely pleasant. Breakfast, at a mere 8 euros, was perfect. With the Rivoli less than two blocks away, and the metro stop only minutes more, this is the place I will hope to re-visit again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Cool”
Reviews.Author: guy22
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Jeanne d'Arc is(92 euro) the location near St. Catherine Square. The lively little place to gather just around the corner, We stayed in room 10 with ample room for my wife and I ,a comfy bed, a great shower, and a perfect breakfast in the morning. The front desk people are pleasant and helpful as can be , We really have to recomend this fine little hotel in Le Marais. We used Bus # 69 to the cities best places, We liked the Bateaux Bus for the river Seine cruise. and of course Paris is a great walking city. In closing a Scotish Pub just a few steps away for pint and a wee nip of fine whiskey, Please enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Okay but shop around”
Reviews.Author: Sir_Russman
Reviews.Content: Good location and reasonable price BUT - rooms have NO fans or AC. Weather when we were there was 24C and the rooms were hot and sweaty - if you're visiting in peak of summer cant imagine how bad it might be. Noise? Walls are thin and no matter what room you're in (we were in 2 different rooms) you hear the lift and people talking/flushing toilets etc. If you sleep like a rock no probs but light sleepers look elsewhere. Rooms at front of building get lots of street noise Good and helpful reception and nice enough. Showers okay but rooms are probably due some upgrading from the 1980s

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: michelleVA
Reviews.Content: i stayed at this hotel for 3 days and loved the location and quirky decor. rooms are average, but were quieter at night than expected. it's just steps away from shopping, restaurants, and the st. paul metro stop. would definitely stay again. also had lots of good sightseeing nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Finally got there!”
Reviews.Author: Italy008
Reviews.Content: We had tried a couple times to book this very popular hotel and finally made it. It lived up to everything we had read...great location, reasonable rates, spotless, good breakfast and helpful staff. The Marais neighborhood is so unique, by itself, but also so close to public transportation...a great base to anything you would want to see in Paris. We had a great 6 night stay and would return if we were fortunate to book again!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Pilatesboy
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here! The staff were very friendly and helpful, the location excellent, and the price unbeatable. Only drawback is that wifi is only available on the ground floor, and the system requires logging in each time you use it. A minor point and we will definitely be bank again! Thanks for making our stay so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: magickgirl1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really in a fabulous spot- about 10 minutes to Notre Dame and the Ile de la Cite, and smack dab in the Marais. The little square right next door is filled with great restaurants that serve pretty late. The lobby and breakfast room is fine, though it struck me more like a nice hostel than a hotel lobby. The rooms themselves are not so nice, plain and small (though I've actually been in smaller...) The bathroom was tiny, and the shower curtain didn't really span the whole tub... They say they have wifi but "not in our room", the hair dryer didn't work, and the breakfast is an additional 7 euro... we skipped it so I can't comment... Overall, I agree with other reviewers, it's an ok spot if you're on a budget or just using it as a crash pad. I'd be lying if I'd say I'd likely go back... I'd probably look around, but if I was priced out elsewhere, a good fall-back option.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but the room seemed expensive for the quality.”
Reviews.Author: CaitlynT
Reviews.Content: This was one of the few hotels I could find in central Paris with a quadruple room, to accommodate two adults and two kids. The location was GREAT! We could walk to Notre Dame, the Centre Pompidou, and other attractions, and there were tons of cafes and shops on the blocks around the hotel. The Tour Eiffel was a simple one-bus ride away. The staff was wonderful, very helpful, and spoke English. The hotel was cute from the outside, and the lobby was nice, but the room was a little shabby for the cost (worn carpet, some peeling walpaper). Then again, everythng in Paris was ridiculously expensive, so it may be that this is just what you get for that price. The room was clean and quiet, except for Friday night when a nearby bar or club was having some sort of dance party!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, simple and good value!”
Reviews.Author: MrsQuesne
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on price and the good reviews here on TripAdvisor. Although the reviews looked good, we were really not expecting much in terms of service, room size etc. At 92 euros pr night, in the middle of Marais, one should be prepared for somewhat depressing conditions. BUT: Hotel Jeanne d'Arc was a pleasant surprise from the moment we walked in the door. The decor of the reception area is pleasant and inviting. The receptionists were all helpful and polite, even when I practised my atrocius French, and were able to help us with a restaurant reservation that had proved too difficult arranging from home. There is free wifi in the reception area, and a computer with printer for guest use. The room was small, but not tiny, and rather basic. The bathroom was quite spacious by European hotel standards. There was no hairdryer in the room, but the reception provided one immedeately when I asked. Everything was very clean. There was some noise from the corridor (doors slamming in the morning etc.), but heard nothing from neighbouring rooms. The new looking windows seem to keep out street noise. We can definately recommend this hotel to anyone who are on a budget, but still wants a nice and central place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “All I want in a hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Timotheus
Reviews.Content: Thanks, Tripadvisor, we went to the Jeanne d'Arc on the advice of other reviewers and were not disappointed. It is a pleasant place to stay and very good value to boot. The decorative state is good; the beds are comfortable; the bathrooms are modern and there is constant hot water; it is very clean. The breakfast, consisting of juice, tea or coffee, bread butter and jam and two kinds of viennoiserie, was good quality and fairly priced at €7.00.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean, great location, and GREAT value!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinFieldGuy
Reviews.Content: This place is simple, not swishy or large, but it's impeccably clean, the staff is friendly, and you can't beat the value! They offer free internet, an OK breakfast (nothing fancy - not the best ever but adequate), and simple small, clean, quiet rooms. Bus #65 easily brings you from the Gare du Nord (Eurostar from London, Thalys from Amsterdam/Brussels, etc.) to this hotel. Le Marais is a great area of Paris. There are lots of things to do, and it is easy to get all over central Paris by foot, bus, or Metro from here. There are several great bistros just around the corner. Les Halles and the Bastille areas are both in easy walking distance with all their great restaurants and night life. We easily walked from here to the Left Bank and the shopping Opera Garnier area (Printemps, etc.) And when you tire of walking, several convenient bus routes pass close by, and the Saint Paul metro is just a few blocks away. For a fun, unusual activity, check out the boat cruise that departs from the canal along the Boulevard Richard Lenoir. There's also a good street market along there some days if memory serves.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Breakaway-6
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at this hotel for the past 15 years - probably 7-8 times. From the moment you walk in the door, you know you're back in friendly territory. The staff are more than helpful, complementary internet facilities (+printer), the rooms are constantly being upgraded, the location is superb - 6-7 restaurants in Place de Catherine behind the hotel, St Paul Metro nearby, 500 yards to the Seine, supermarkets within 100 yards, the superb Marais all around, & Place des Vosges 150 yards away, where you can while away an hour - or a day - just watching Paris pass before your eyes. We wouldn't stay anywhere else in Paris. We've recommended it to at least 5 other friends - they were all delighted with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo Hotel Jeanne d'Arc”
Reviews.Author: Traveljoie
Reviews.Content: We love the location and accommodations. Recent renovations include new plumbing/bathrooms. Our stall rain shower had pressure and plenty of hot water. The rooms have new and comfortable mattresses. The staff at the hotel are very helpful, especially Stephan, who is there most days. They added a computer for the guests to the lobby (with a printer for boarding passes). Wifi is available in the lobby for all who need it! We have stayed at this hotel for 17 years and it has always been GREAT, but now it is SUPER with the new improvements.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: ElgarMedford_OR
Reviews.Content: Hotel Jeanne d'Arc is a comfortably small hotel in a great location. Staff is friendly and helpful. Our room was clean, reasonably spacious for a large city urban hotel. WiFi worked at the ground level but not in our room. Breakfast (coffee, tea or coco plus baguette, croissant and chocolate croissant) was convenient and priced competitively with nearby options. Window opens the room includes a fan but no AC (September was fine). Secured left luggage allowed us to tour after checking out and before our transfer to the airport. Expect late night street sounds during weekend evenings/nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and in wonderful Marais!”
Reviews.Author: Leamsi
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful, just right, they even gave me a nice upgrade, the neighborhood is wonderful although a bit noisy at night. I would LOVE to go back for a longer stay. What more can I say?

Reviews.Title: “A Solid 2 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nwtravelerOregon
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Jeanne d' Arc. We had stayed here some years ago; it has changed little although there are improvements such as freshly painted walls and a new tiny lift, making it easier to take bags up several flights. The staff is friendly and helpful. There is wi-fi and a guest computer in the reception area. Our room had everything needed for a comfortable and secure stay while exploring Paris. There was some street noise although pretty typical for a city. We didn't buy the breakfast as it seemed pricey for what it was, but there are several nearby cafes. The best thing about this hotel is its location. It is within walking distance of many interesting areas and cultural sites and it is near a metro stop. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: BradleyJP
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Jeanne D'Arc with four friends. Because of differing schedules, we stayed in a single room, a double/triple room, and a quadruple room. Single room had double bed and was very small. Almost a New York type size. Double/triple and quadruple rooms were spacious. Large bathrooms. Clean. I loved the decor...it's simple and a little worn, but seemed very French to me. Location is decent. About 5 min walk to the St. Paul metro stop, which will take you to main tourist spots like the Louvre or Hotel D'Ville easily. (Just two stops). Walking from hotel to theis places would be a little far for most travellers. wanted to walk. There was some street noise from neighbors and pedestrians. With windows closed, it was sufficiently muffled. If you keep the window open, you'll know you're in a city with some life at night. Of the three tourist-class hotels I have stayed at in Paris, this was easily the best experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pandiani
Reviews.Content: Excellent budget hotel in a great area. Have stayed here twice in November '08 and July '09. This is not a luxury hotel but if like us you only want a room to sleep in this is perfect, the rooms are spotless, the bathroom is clean and its in a good area, only a few minutes walk to St Paul metro, we felt very safe in the area at night also, breakfast was brought to the room and was €6, it inclued a baguette, croissant and pain au chocolat and butter and jams, orange juice and the choice of tea/coffee, There are some lovely restaurants surrounding hotel, particularly "Les Bougresses" on the same street and about 6 or 7 others in a square behind the hotel. Would highly recommend this hotel to people on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were after for our Paris stay”
Reviews.Author: Chad_Valiant
Reviews.Content: We were after a cheap stay in Paris for three nights, and spent a lot of time researching options on TripAdvisor and elsewhere... settled on this hotel and it turned out to be pretty much exactly what we were after. The location is fantastic, not a very touristy area and plenty of cafes etc. around, a short walk to two Metro stations or the islands on the Seine, and we happily walked further along the river to the various museums etc. The hotel is certainly not luxurious but perfectly comfortable, slightly run down but not dirty, typical cheesey decor and our room on the first floor was actually larger than we expected for Paris. Was hot at night, and yes noisy with the windows open, but we had a fan in our room so didn't mind the lack of AC. The staff weren't unpleasant, maybe a little aloof - isn't that just a French thing? - and gave us the minor bits of assistance that we needed. Overall was just what we needed, a comfy place to crash in between adventures, and very good value. (I note that other reviews have observed similar things to me and been unimpressed by them, I guess it comes down to your expectations though!)

Reviews.Title: “Not Perfect but an Excellent Location for a Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: marsle
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Hotel Jeanne d'Arc so we knew what to expect. The rooms are small but not bad by Paris standards. The location in the Marais is perfectly situated near Ile St. Louis, many good restaurants, the St. Paul Metro and Gare de Lyon. Fortunately for us, the weather was cool so the lack of air conditioning wasn't a problem but later in the season, I'd be reluctant to book a hotel without a/c. A fan was provided however. We found most of the staff to be friendly. If hot weather wasn't an issue, we would absolutely return to this hotel because of the excellent value and location.

Reviews.Title: “In need of an update”
Reviews.Author: Jane0515
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. No air conditioning and the streets are very noisy. The staff is not friendly at all. The towels are so thin, you can barely dry with them. There was not a single outlet in the bathroom. I had to stand outside the bathroom to dry my hair. The sheets are very scratchy and the rooms need to be updated. The free wi-fi only works in the lobby. I guess for 90 Euro, it is a bargain for Paris. We were here to see the museums and other points of interest and this was a great location to St. Paul Metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain for sure-for a reason”
Reviews.Author: SouthernGal54
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 8 nights (May 14-22 2010) in a double room . Best part_getting a bill for just 734 Euros. Had room 10 (the good-big bathroom by local standards). It was on the 1st floor (american 2nd floor) facing the street-noisy!!!!!!!! You could touch the trash truck when it came by very early. Had some drunk people noises around 2 to 4 am. These noises were not from the hotel-could not see anyone on the street-so it must be coming from the St.Catherine Sq a few yards away. Like other reviewers stated, staff doesn't seem too interested in customer service (and I mean basic) The rooms are "tired" looking. Get what you paid for-but great location. Stayed in a 3 star last visit (this is a 2 star) and couldn't tell much difference in room size and condition. Would not stay again but great if you are on a tight budget or staying for a real short period of time.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it for the price”
Reviews.Author: Etienne_et_Catherine
Reviews.Content: After reading the positive reviews on Tripadvisor.com, we lucked out on the only room available in a 3-month time span when we booked our one-night stay at this hotel. While it's true that we did get a friendlier welcome from other hotel service staff and owners in other locations in France during our journey, I will look to stay here again for a future visit to Paris. Clean, cute decor (tricky stairs included), excellent value, and the location can't be beat. A+

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, best location”
Reviews.Author: Lambmelamed
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location and price of this hotel. It is a very basic hotel but when you are in Paris you only use a hotel to sleep and shower and this hotel provides both. Towels were starting to shred on the edges, some staff not that friendly but we paid 160 euros for 4 people. You can not beat that price for the Marais. I would stay there again time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “My new go-to hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: risamay
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Hotel Jeanne d'Arc. I like to stay in the Marais, but my previous go-to hotel choice is too expensive these days (the Hotel Caron de Beaumarchais). So I decided to try something new. I found the Hotel Jeanne d'Arc to be lovely. GREAT location, basic rooms, GREAT price, no complaints. And very accommodating. I was only supposed to spend 4 nights there and go on to Nice, but my Nice plans were canceled due to the volcanic eruption in Iceland. The staff at the Hotel Jeanne d'Arc was able to extend my stay with them for a full 17 nights, and it was wonderful. I couldn't have been happier. And as another reviewer noted who was in a similar predicament, the hotel did not jack up the prices for the extended stay and shuffling. This was much appreciated. I will definitely stay with the Hotel Jeanne d'Arc again on my next trip to Paris, as well as recommend them to friends and family. No question about it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: Mian2010
Reviews.Content: We were stranded in Paris during the Iceland volcano eruption. Luckily the lady at Jeanne d"Arc informed us before we checked out of the hotel. They were very accommodating. Arranged for us to extend our stay at the hotel without jacking up the price for which I was very very glad. No question was asked or additional charge incurred when we informed them on 22nd April that we got confirmed seats to fly out of Paris on 23rd April. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK.”
Reviews.Author: matevzh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few nights in April. I booked it through the internet and everything went through flawlessly. About the hotel... good... location, location, location. Its excellent. Close to the metro, close to superb restaurants, close to shopping area, walking distance to Notre dame, Louvre,... In total, hotel is a great value. 90 EUR for double is difficult to get in an expensive Paris. Also breakfast was good and great value, however apparently coffee tasted strange (i don't drink coffee, so i couldn't verify this). Staff was OK, helpful with advice. Free wireless internet is available (you get the code at the reception), however, it only works on a ground floor and maybe on the 1st floor. A computer with internet access is also freely available. What didn't like was the room. It was clean enough, on a small size, well furnished, just... a view... well, i didn't expect a view for 90 EUR, but looking onto a shaft made the room very dark, and you couldn't tell what kind of weather is outside. The furniture looked outdated, but i really didn't mind. Unfortunately we weren't able to move, as the hotel was completely full... But... on the other hand, it was completely quiet. My relatively bad mark goes only to the room, or better, to its "location". What i have seen majority of rooms they look onto the street, and have normal windows. These rooms are probably a good choice. But at the end of the day, how much time do you actually spend in the room?!? Would I choose again the hotel? Yes. Hotel is a good value find in Paris. And some rooms are better than others. Unfortunately. They gave us one of less desired rooms nevertheless that i already reserved 6 months before...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: EwaDenmark
Reviews.Content: Super location - 10 minutes stroll to the Seine, Ile de la Cité etc. Friendly helpful staff, nice and clean rooms in "an-above-average-Paris-size". Le Marais is a wonderful neighbourhood, full of life and good speciality shops. Absolutely recommendable.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, service, and location.”
Reviews.Author: paparufus
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a one week stay at this wonderful hotel. For the $ 124 a night they charge, you'd be hard pressed to find a better accomodation in Paris. I was lucky enough to book well ahead so I had a corner room, which was larger than the others, with double windows and views from the 5th floor. I saw the other rooms beside me, and they were quite small. The hotel is clean, the reception polite and professional, and the beds are very comfortable. The staff were nice enough to store a suitcase for me for two weeks while I took a side trip to Morocco. There is ample heating in winter if you have the valve on the radiator open, but there is no AC in summer. There is a nice flat screen TV with 20 channels mostly in French but there was CNN. The location is perfect for sightseeing in the 3rd,4th, and 5th arrondissements. There is a great bakery called Manon on the main blvd. and there are many asian restaurants that offer a tasty inexpensive alternative to fine dining. Be sure to try the amazing falafel at l'As du Fallafel on rue des Rosiers in the Jewish quarter. Subway access is either Saint Paul or Bastille. Do not hesitate to book this hotel. You could do a lot worse in Paris for a lot more money.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Price”
Reviews.Author: coreyman97
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have mentioned, you cannot beat the location - right in the heart of the Marais. At 90 euros/night for 2 people, the price is certainly worth it. Our room was VERY sparse - not a photo on the wall and not a tissue to be had. The bathroom was renovated but as small a bathroom as I've ever been. The staff was OK. they answered questions but were not really helpful with recommendations. These are not complaints, just my view so you are not surprised when you arrive. It's no frills and worked for us so we could spend more on great dining in Paris. With the exchange rate weak, it all worked. Would I stay here again? It depends on how much more per night I'd have to spend for a higher quality hotel in the Marais.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, great location, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Sainteefs
Reviews.Content: Hotel Jeanne d'Arc is in a great location - le Marais is a great place for a wander plus Notre Dame and the islands are within walking distance. There are plenty of things to see and places to eat on the door step. The hotel was warm and comfortable - room was small but if you're only there for the weekend then it doesn't matter too much. The hotel had some lovely quirky features - the old wooden staircase and the eye-catching Gaudi-esque mirror being my favourites. My main complaint is that the team were totally unapologetic when they rang my husband two days before we arrived to tell them there was a problem with the booking and they had no space for Saturday night. Only when he put his foot down and insisted that he didn't want to spend one of of two days in Paris dragging his pregnant wife around looking for another room did they agree to find us somewhere else. They put us in a nearby but far less attractive room and weren't in the slightest bit apologetic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not the lap of luxury”
Reviews.Author: worldlywahoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on a recent trip to Paris and everything was perfectly fine. The location is excellent -- stumbling distance from great bakeries, cafes and restaurants and a short walk to the Bastille monument, etc. -- but the rooms are on the shabby side of "shabby chic." Our room definitely could have used a fresh coat of paint. The guy at the front desk was helpful but not overly frendly. The rooms had soap and body wash but no shampoo. These are all little things, though, because in the end, you are in Paris, in a great location, and you can't beat the price. Also, the water pressure in the shower is fabulous. (Hey, it's the little things, right?)

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for the location alone”
Reviews.Author: Kazcucumber
Reviews.Content: Right smack in the heart of Le Marais, it's the perfect location to explore the area and get amongst the shops, the Pompidou, the Lourve and of course shopping. I had the singles room on the 3rd floor which was very cheap, but had a double bed, and was doable. The price was reasonable, but as other travellers say the sound between the walls was crap, you could seriously hear every word and every sound the TV's in the rooms either side made! Luckily most nights people went to sleep reasonably early. The manager seems to be ok, has good English and quite helpful, even got me a hairdryer one day which was useful. You could eat breakfast downstairs but there's some lovely Boulangeries around the road so would hold out if I was you. All in all a great location, budget rooms, but good price.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: DiCoz
Reviews.Content: This charmingly decorated hotel is located just of the Rue de Rivoli in the Marais - an awesome arrondisement to be based in. The hotel is surrounded by beautiful streets, lots of boutiques, patisseries, boulangeries, and countless restaurants and cafes. It is perhaps a 10 minute walk from Notre Dame. My room was basic and didn't look quite finished (walls had been visibly patched/plastered) but they've gone to a lot of effort to make the room warm and inviting, with cute artwork on the wall. The room (double bed) was small but not tiny, with a separate bathroom. The bed was comfortable and the shower was very good. The staff spoke fluent French and were courteous and helpful. Once the windows were shut there was no problem with street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in the Marais District”
Reviews.Author: rivercat74
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Hotel Jeanne D'Arc. Our room was small, but had everything we needed. It was clean and had modern conveniences and the rates were good compared to other hotels in the area. There is no air conditioner or lift, which is why they can keep their rates down. We were able to use the phone in our room with our international phone card to call home. It was noisy from a club nearby one night, but the hotel staff said that if you complain to them they will call the club. We were only a short walk away from the St. Paul Metro stop, 2 grocery stores, the Jewish Quarter and lots of restaurants and shops. The staff were friendly and very helpful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Here's the deal....”
Reviews.Author: JoshuaSims
Reviews.Content: here's the deal ... The Hotel is old, the hotel has some odd color combinations in the rooms ... the Hotel is extremely french, Chic young people stay there so they can spend their money else where, and because the location is amazing. There are quarks, and there are downsides, but over all its the French experience. I love this hotel. I stay there almost everytime I go to Paris. Its especially fun during fashion, and textile weeks. BOOK IN ADVANCE or you get a smaller room on a higher floor. Be polite to the reception as they will love you for it, and they can make or break a vaction if they think you're an -----. I choose "excellent" for this hotel not because its really beautiful ... stay at the Georges 5 for that ... Nor because its pampering ... stay at the Ritz for that, but because for what you pay you get ten times more than you deserve. And you will find europeans in your hotel unlike the holiday inn, (which I have never stayed at but can only imagine), and so you will have a real european (as much as thats possible in a week) experince

Reviews.Title: “Paris for the 'first timers'”
Reviews.Author: LanaOttawa
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 5 days in Paris and thought I should share my experience, especially for the 'first timers' like I was. I was also a solo traveller. I stayed in a "Jeanne d'Arc" hotel in Marais. I took the RER B train to Chatelet metro station and then Metro #1 to the metro stop close to the hotel. Very simple and convenient and cheap. The only thing is that if you have more luggage that may not work. I had a carry on and a suitcase and I had to lift it up quite a few times on my way back to the airport. No problem for me, but it may be for someone else. The other option is a bus and a cab, or a cab all the way. Hotel was great, relatively cheap for the location and very clean. I suggest you book it early as it was completely full for the time I was there. Staff there was quite helpful..and even when I requested items like a knife, bottle opener, a wine glass, that was no issue as they do have a kitchen as well (you can order a breakfast for 6 euros while there). The only thing I didn't like was the fact that they didn't have internet connection on a computer on the ground floor for all 5 days I was there (they said it should work , but it actually never did and I think they just kept saying so just to get everyone of their back). I ate breakfast at the hotel a few mornings, but really preffered going to the "Miss Manon"'s boulangerie on rue Saint-Antoine (just around the corner from the hotel). Lovely pastries, desserts and amazing cafe creme. Hotel is located in a very nice area although close to a little courtyard with a few restaurants. There was a bit of noise outside from time to time, but it didn't prevent me from sleeping. Normally it gets quiet around midnight. Metro station was only a few minutes (3-4) away from the hotel - very convenient. I had walked most of the time, but ended up taking metro a few times just to be able to get to a few places. I didn't have an itinerary and just decided what I'm going to do the day before. Didn't go to Louvre (gasp!!) but did visit a free historical museum of Paris - Carnavalet (Marais) which was very interesting and Musee d'Orsay for all the impressionists' work. Both museums were excellent. My goal was really to walk around and see as much as I can on foot. Wanted to enjoy as much architecture as I can and find a spot to have a cofee and people watch (mind you, I didn't do as much of that as I should have). I did go to some major attractions - Eiffel Tower, Monmartre, Louvre (well, the building, Tuillers Gardens etc), Notre Dame, St-Germain area, Jardin de Luxembourg, Pantheon, Place de la Concorde, Arc de Triomphe, The Champs-Elysees, Opera Garnier, Grand and Petip Palais, Musee Carnavalet & Musee d'Orsay, Place des Vosges, Hotel de Ville (City Hall), Centre Pompidou, both islands of the city and the bridges...:) By total coincidence I came across two restaurants that were recommended in Lonely Planet guide and I ate at both of them: Chez Marianne (jewish, Marais) and Le Petit Marche (Marais). Both were very good. The rest of the places I ate at were OK. (do recommend getting a falafel sandwich at the Chez Marianne...if you're just getting something to go - I ended up having a 'sit down' dinner and a sandwich another day). People and waiters(!) were generally helpful and considerate. If you showed even slight interest in French, the waiters were more than happy to help you. I didn't get too much into conversation with anyone, but generally only had nice experience and found that quite a few people spoke at least a bit of English. I didn't really see any pickpocketing or hassling going on...except for a few bracelet guys that were easily avoidable (but I did talk to a girl who ended up fighting with one of them after she let him put a bracelet on her). A few gypsy women would ask you if you speak English....just saying 'no' would make them go away. I did see signs everywhere in the metro to be aware of pick-pocketing so I'm sure that is an issue when it is really crowded. I didn't experience that.. Overall, it was a great, great experience and I'm definitely planning to go back again to do the rest of the sightseeing...like taking a cruise on Seine at night. Hope this helps a bit... Just be aware that we all have different expectations from our travels when you read the posts. Someone would not even bother picking up suitcase and carry it down a flight of stairs, while some like me...didn't even think twice about it. It is very personal and you have to take all the posts with that in mind. Au revoir! p.s. don't forget to say 'Bonjour' and 'Au revoir' upon enterin/exit a store, restaurant etc. They are very polite and expect you to be.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, suoerb location”
Reviews.Author: jenesaisfckall
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Jeanne D'Arc is fairly basic, but well-priced (for Paris) and excellently located in the heart of the bustling Marais. Our room was quite spacious, and comfortable if a little shabby. Shower was a dribble but more or less did the job. The staff are helpful and knowledgeable. Overall, recommended. (Incidentally, the whole area is chockfull of bars, cafes and restaurants - try the nearby Rue Des Rosiers for slightly cheaper North African/Arab eateries.)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: LSM2107
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Jeanne d'Arc for 4 nights in August. Our room was a typical small and basic European hotel room. There was no air conditioning, but there was a fan in the room and it was surprisingly cool at night. Free internet was available downstairs. The best thing about the hotel is its location in Les Marais- close to lots of nice stores, restaurants, parks and squares, and near a metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “A cute little place with much character, close and convenient to everything”
Reviews.Author: Quirindi
Reviews.Content: A quaint, homely little place is Jeanne d'Arc with obliging helpful staff. Our room though small, was tastefully decorated, and the bed was comfortable. No air-conditioning - Paris had some 30 degree days even in May when we stayed. We may have made a mistake asking for a room at the rear of the hotel in case of street noise as we overlooked a small empty courtyard, which was quiet during the day, but at night there were cooking smells and in the early hours the clattering of kitchen equipment, and people chatting and doing other things outside.ate at Miss Manon's for breakfast but decided to "eat in" for our other breakfasts as it was much cheaper for the same things. We found we could walk to most places from the hotel and we were never lost for local eateries. The Batobus and Metro are very handy to Jeanne d'Arc for the further attractions. Free internet was a bonus. We really enjoyed out stay and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jopi81
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights in Paris and our stay in Hotel Jeanne d'Arc was very pleasent. Location was the biggest plus. We felt always safe, Marais is very lively and beautiful district and the hotel has following services very close: metro, laundry, grocery shops, ATM, cheap chinese takeaway. The room was small, overall condition of the rooms was good but the carpet has seen its better days. There is no hair dryer but we got one for free at the reception immediately. Reception was very helpful and they have good collection of guidebooks available. There is a luggage room and safe at the reception. Breakfest can be ordered separately for each morning its standard continental and recommended. We were in 3rd floor windows facing to the street and we weren't disturbed by any noises.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locale Great Price Great for Paris”
Reviews.Author: DeHoff
Reviews.Content: Rooms are adequate, very clean, staff are freindly and helpful. The location is the best thing - close to metro, the Siene, restaurants and sights Great Value overall

Reviews.Title: “A good value hotel and certainly one of the cheaper ones!”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi1963
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. We paid 116 euro per night for a twin bedded room. We had four nights here at the beginning of our France holiday and then returned for another night at the end. Felt safe staying here. Only a 5 minute walk to the St. Paul metro station which is on the no. 1 line. This was very convenient indeed. Hotel was quiet. On our second visit to this hotel, we were fortunate to get a booking on the day. We were given Room 002 which was a Disabled room with two bedrooms and a huge bathroom. It was on the ground floor. If you are disabled, a great choice for you also.

Reviews.Title: “Our Go-To Hotel in Paris for its Great Location, Service, Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: maggie_mlb
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Jeanne D'Arc via TripAdvisor and were compelled by reviews stating the hotel was clean, in a great location and ultimately affordable (about 82 euros per night). This was the perfect hotel for us (a young couple in our 20s) because it was quaint, oh-so-French, and in a location popular with locals, not tourists. This was our first trip to Paris, but we've found a permanent home at the Hotel Jeanne D'Arc for the next time we go! As for the amenities, the rooms are small by American standards and are a little quirky -- not for lovers of the standard Holiday Inn. You may take the one-person elevator up to your room or use the winding staircase up to the top floor, seven flights up. There's a 6 euro breakfast each morning, which we only used on our last day unfortunately. Turned out it was a great deal for Paris eating -- including coffee, juice, bread, croissants, pain au chocolat and jams in the lovely lobby area. Also a great way to meet fellow travelers. The staff is friendly, accommodating and spoke English. Don't forget to leave your room key at the door each time you leave -- a hotel policy! There were some downsides, but we weren't particularly bothered by them. If consistent water temperature in the bathroom is a deal-breaker for you, then this hotel is not recommended. We had a little trouble each morning either getting burned or iced in the shower. You'll also find the TV station selection a little limited -- but who goes to Paris to watch TV? Finally, there is free Internet, but it's only available in the lobby area and you must ask for an access code from the front desk. As for the area, we found the Marais to be safe and untouristy. Very close to both the St. Paul and Bastille metro stops, we had no trouble finding the hotel or navigating the city once arrived. We were even able to walk to a lot of our destinations -- Notre Dame, Centre Pompidou, Place de Vosges, Rue de Rivoli, etc. The Marais itself is a lovely area with (expensive) clothing boutiques, lots of Jewish eateries, and choc-full of fine little squares lined with popular cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Surely I will come here again as I also recommend it”
Reviews.Author: chiararts
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here with a few friends for 4 nights between dec 08 and jan 09. The hotel is located in a wonderful position just a few steps away from the metro station (St. Paul). We decided not to have breakfast in hotel so we went to "Boulangerie Paul" which is like 100 m away from the hotel. The rooms are not so big but they are big enough to take a shower and sleep. Also they contain all facilities like hair drier, tv, phone, wardrobe etc.. The staff was very kind and always helpful to people at all time. Surely I will come here again as I also recommend it ;)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for people with small children”
Reviews.Author: EmilyPeabody
Reviews.Content: The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was large and quiet, and they provided a baby bed that was in good condition and set up correctly. The breakfast room has a wooden high chair with little beads on it, which our 10-month-old enjoyed. Only problem was the lift, which opened in the middle of the stairwell -- not much they can do about that, though, with the way the building's constructed. You can't take a pram up to the first floor, but that's not uncommon in French hotels and they let us keep it in the reception area.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Liebez
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for 4 nights just a few days ago and we were both enthusiast with this amazing hotel. Our room was #61, on the last floor. It was BIG and very clean (they came to do our room every single day) and it was so pretty! Very bohemian, it seemed to stay in a movie! The location was perfect, just 2 mins aways from the St. Paul metro, in a quiet street near a place full of restaurant (but the one we tried was VERY expensive). We had a late flight both arriving and leaving and the staff let us check in after 1AM and kept our bags in a locked room until 5PM when we left. Breakfast was good but maybe a little expensive. We both didn't find anything wrong in this hotel and are already suggesting it to all our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: DomCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the summer of 2008 for 4 nights and it was perfect for Paris! Pros - excellent location right in the middle of Marais, close to subway, and yet on a quiet street, which can be rare in Paris - great value for money but still, the room had everything we were looking for (no luxeries but comfortable stay) Cons - no big issues PS: When in Paris there's lot of great places to eat but I really enjoyed our dinner at "Crémerie-Restaurant Polidor" - authentic french couisine and the restaurant has been around since 1845. The prices are very reasonalbe too!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneFrannie
Reviews.Content: A great location, and for a 2 star place, comfortable rooms and helpful staff. Our group of 6 women from the same family had a great time. We were given lots of help from the staff when we had a few problems - lost luggage , sick family member etc. We were able to gather in the breakfast room and bring in our drinks before dinner, and were made to feel welcome. The rooms are a good size , renovations are almost complete and the noise in winter is not a problem. Good restaurants are nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel.”
Reviews.Author: reesapeesa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel twice during our trip. The first 2 nights we were put in a room on the 3rd floor. The room had a rustic/charming decor to it and the bathroom was very large. The pillows and bed were comfortable and since we were in a corner room, we had a decent view as well. Then we left Paris for a short trip to Provence and stayed in this hotel again for another 3 nights. This time, we were super lucky. For some reason, we were given their largest & nicest room in the hotel. It's their suite for 4 people. It had a double size bed, a separate room with 2 additional single size bed and a brand new beautiful large modern bathroom. The decor of the room was different from the other rooms as it was more modern too. I was a little confused why we were given that room since there were only the 2 of us so we had asked the person at the front desk if the room was still 89 euro/night for us and it was! If I was to actually book this room, it will cost 170 euro/night! We were very lucky. It is the only room on the ground floor (room #2). Before leaving for Paris, I was a afraid about the noise issue of this hotel from the reviews I was reading. You can definitely hear people outside & inside the hotel talking or the garbage guy collecting all the city garbage. This didn't bother me as much as I thought it would. ALthough for light sleepers, I would recommend a different hotel. Overall, it's a great hotel in the middle of the Marais. The location is fantastic! Whether I'm going to stay here or not again in the future, that I'm not sure. I would be open to researching for another hotel. However, if I don't find anything for the same price & quality, I would be more than happy staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worse than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: mh1HoiAn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my partner and another couple - all of us from Australia. Ok this hotel is in Paris and in a very desirable location - in the historic Marais and close to all major attractions and subway. That's where the story ends. For less money we have stayed in equally desirable locations in other cities in the world with complimentary breakfast thrown in. This place seems to be in a perpetual state of home handyman style renovation. The foyer looks good but then the 'fun' begins. First we were given a room on the bottom floor which wasn't too bad but extremely noisy as it faced a side alley so couldn't open the window. The receptionist offered to move us to a 'very good' room on the third floor. This turned out to be worse in several respects than the first room. No mirror at all in the main room, a tiny bathroom with a shower head that we had to tape up with gafa tape to keep from falling down and the bath took over half an hour to drain after the shower. We fared better than our friends upstairs who had to sit in the bath holding the shower hose over their head to have a shower as the water pressure did not want to defy gravity. The bath and shower were clean but tiles above the bath were very grubby and covered in mould as was the ceiling in the bathroom. Friends upstairs on the fifth floor said their whole bathroom was mould covered. Beds were comfortable enough and bedding clean. Decor horrific...but expected for a two star hotel. Generally quite a stingy hotel with nothing extra offered. Asked for an iron as we had been travelling for a long timeand local laundromats did not offer ironing. Asked if there was an ironing room downstairs that we could use. Told by Stefan - one of the receptionts - that the hotel used to have an ironing room but no longer had one. When I asked him if he could provide an iron for guests he said that he would try to find one but 'it would be difficult'. Twenty four hours an iron materialised as did a mirror for the main room which I was told not to break as they like it very much. Dutifully returned the iron on the last day to a female receptionist (Virginie) who was in the company of a friend? employee? She dramatically exclaimed that we should never have had this iron as people had ironed on the carpets previously and caused damage and that the iron should have been used downstairs. She also mentioned dramatically that if the owner found out that the iron had been used in the room she (the owner)would be most upset. Virginie spoke in French to her companion whilst inspecting the underside of the iron (presumably for tell-tale carpet fibres!!). I resisted the urge to comment that no way would I have ironed my clothes on the dirty and stained carpet in the room and that we had wanted to iron our clothes downstairs in the first place. Also resisted the urge at the time to state that this impoliteness to guests was unwarranted given that the problem started initially with an employee. I suggested that she speak to the employee concerned who had given out the precious iron - however she indicated that she did not want to do this (perhaps for fear of upsetting him or the owner) - yes, much better to upset guests instead!! Overall, a dark and uninviting room that needed a total overhaul - OK it is 2 star but still not inexpensive (E116 per night). There are better options and 2 star or not the least that can be expected is a clean bathroom. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great base in Paris - does the job!”
Reviews.Author: Gl0be_Tr0tter88
Reviews.Content: Location .. is the main reason for us to book this hotel. We could easily walk into the city, and the Metro (St Paul - Line 1) is just 3 minutes walk away. Or you can find Bastile nightlife 10 minutes away. Noise is the main problem. You get rubbish and bar cleaners waking you up at 6am; and drunkards keeping you wake! There is no air-conditioning, so you will need to open the windows - thus the noise. Being in Paris, the buildings are very close by!! You can easily see your neighbours! Hotel room is just basic - nothing to shout about. Size is minimal. The hotel is in the middle of refurbishment. Honestly, they could have done more to improve their facilities. You will have to pay extra for breakfast. For €6 breakfast, it is considered cheap in Paris! Or you could try other cafes nearby the area for more than €9! Location is the main reason for us. Perhaps another hotel in the nearby area could be considered. Nevertheless, we had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Sandy021
Reviews.Content: We spend 2 nights (and our US friends 5 nights) in this hotel. I booked it because of other people comments in this website. I think the location is good and very central to walk around, if you are into BARs, 'cheap' restaurant, night life etc etc. If you are looking for a quiter - more residential part of Paris, than maybe the area is not that good for you. I would not really go there with children, young children... this is the gay area - so probably a bit too much explanations to do, when walking in the evening ! The hotel is clean, I think they are refurbishing it (I have a feeling that they are making 6 rooms in each floor where they used to have 4 rooms, but I could be wrong). The bathroom are small, but clean. Showers are ok... The rooms are small, but for what you need to use are ok. The one in the inside of the building (we stayed - nr 45, but all the ending in 5 are the same...not sure abou the other side of the stairs which are the one that have a similar problem) are really small and probably because not much air/light a bit smelly - but once you open the window and turn the fan open it is ok - for short stay eg 3-4 nights. Not for any longer... The hotel is good value for 2 people: 4 people you are probably better off looking for an apartment (160 euro x night and no discount for kids - plus you end up being all in 1 room !!) The breakfast for 6 euro per person is good: fresh baguette, fresh small crossaint, fresh pain choccolate and jam and butter and a cup of coffe - one only of each but in the street you can pay up to 5 euro for 1 cup of coffee. So overall it is ok...nothig too special. Wouldn't say EXCELLENT but I wouldn't either say Terrible.

Reviews.Title: “What you pay is what you get”
Reviews.Author: AHague
Reviews.Content: The location is awesome, right in the middle of the Marais (metro station St. Paul is close, but not right beside), but I won't stay in this hotel again. The room is really, really small and the walls are so thin I woke up several times in the middle of the night/early in the day with other guests arriving/leaving.

Reviews.Title: “dreadful hotel”
Reviews.Author: roomaway
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of this hotel on this site back in January, I booked it (6 months in advance) but now having stayed there I can't believe it is the same place. We stayed for 4 sleepless nights at the end of June. We changed rooms 3 times. The first room was a dark, airless one under the stairs on the first floor. The next one on the second floor had a waste pipe running down it inside the room so we heard water all night - and everything in the room next door - even the seat being put down on the toilet. Our third room was on the 4th floor. As tired as we were, and with ear plugs, we could still hear banging doors, our neighbours in the bathroom, and bursts of noise from the busy street below. It was very hot so we had to leave the window ajar for some air. There was no fan. Even a two star hotel needs to get the basics right. If you can't sleep comfortably in a hotel, then it has failed its purpose. Friends are visiting Paris in a couple of months and I will not be recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a deal!”
Reviews.Author: plafield
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 nights at this hotel and were a bit nervous about it because 10 nights is a long time if the room is uncomfortable, but we went for location and price (84 Euro a night for a double) and were not disappointed.
