We were very happily relieved to find a clean, decent sized room, very comfortable bed, very large bathroom, and a helpful, English speaking staff. We were also there while they were renovating so there was scaffolding up which obstructed our view out the window a bit but other than that it had no effect on us at all. We booked almost a year in advance and they had raised the price of a double by 5 euro but honored the price which we booked it at. Because of renovations they offered us free breakfast or a deduction of 6 euro per person so we took the discount for not having breakfast which made what was already a great value even better. We ended up paying 72 Euro a night for a great little room in a fabulous location. The hotel has very few amenities and the towels are a little thin etc, but it is spotless and the location cannot be beat. The staff, while helpful, are not overly friendly, but more than willing to make restaurant reservations or do their best to answer questions. I'm surprised to read reviews saying that there was no street noise though. There is a courtyard that has outdoor seating for a number of restaurants and bars just a few doors down and if we left our front window open, there was definitely noise from people partying most evenings until well after midnight. And there is a motor bike parking area at the top of the street so there was a lot of motorcycle noise too. Fortunately, we had perfect weather, warm during the day and cool enough at night to close the front window. I'm not sure I'd stay here in the warmer months though. There's no air conditioning and the noise would keep me up at night if I left the windows open. But in fall, winter and early spring, I'd come back even with the higher price (now up to 89 euro for a double.) It's real value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: JamesIslandTraveler
Reviews.Content: My family (parents, two aunts, brother and sister-in-law) and I stayed at the Hotel Jeanne d'Arc in May of 2008. All but one of us had stayed there before, so we were familiar with the hotel. The hotel was undergoing renovations, but that process did not cause any problems for us. The location is excellent. It is in a lively neighborhood that is near many "must see" destinations, close to bus and metro stops, and convenient for shopping and dining. The staff is both kind and professional. They assisted my brother in making arrangements for some side trips and reserved taxis for our return to the airport at the end of our stay. When my Father fell victim to pickpockets, the staff was particularly helpful. The breakfast is a good value, especially if you do not want to go into the city early in the morning to find your pastry and coffee/tea/hot chocolate. (Remember, however, that it is easy to do that!) The rooms vary in decor and scale. If you have particular needs or requirements, be sure to specify them when you reserve your rooms - and do that early. The staff will do all that they can to acommodate your needs, but remember that you will not be staying in a Holiday Inn or a Hilton. That is the point of travel, isn't it? We look forward to staying at the Hotel Jeanne d'Arc when we return to Paris. We want to see the results of the renovations!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Option for Paris”
Reviews.Author: mahona73
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Hotel Jeanne D'Arc from June 6-13, 2008. They are still renovating, but it really doesn't affect visitors. The hotel is in a wonderful location in the Marais. Incredibly close to St Paul and Bastille Metros. The rooms are nicely appointed and clean. There is wonderful hot water supply and pressure. My room (#12) would benefit from a few more electrical outlets. I was on the first floor, so no great views but the convenience of avoiding stairs/waiting for the elevator was appreciated. The hotel is located near a very cute square with several dining options. Great shopping to be found nearby too. I was pleasantly surprised by how quiet the area was at night - sleeping was not a problem. I would highly recommend this hotel. The Marais is my preferred location for staying in Paris and the price can't be beat. Very helpful staff who speak very good English.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Marais”
Reviews.Author: nzcam
Reviews.Content: An excellent little hotel in Marais! We are travelling on our honeymoon and this hotel was perfect for us. We got an exceptional room (#52) on a corner with a view of the street and the parisian roof tops. Lots of great cafes (try Miss Manon for great pastries and sandwiches!), laundromats, supermarkets, restaurants, designer shops in the area, 5 minute walk to St Paul Metro, 10 minutes to Notre Dame, pont Neuf, Hotel De Ville and a walkable distance to the Louvre. Friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast was 6 Euro (we didn't eat at the hotel but that is cheaper than the cafes we ate at) Wifi available for purchase (10 Euro for a week) but there is free wifi in a great park around the corner (Place de Vosges - the oldest square in Paris) We are coming back through Paris in 4 months and are definitely staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Great Location Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Krystle0819
Reviews.Content: I just came back from visiting London and Paris and we stayed at the Hotel Jeanne d'Arc from April 20th-23rd. Upon arriving, our taxi driver was a little unsure of the street name because it is a small street so make sure that you specify that is in the Marais if you take a taxi. He also told us that this was a very good area, very safe and that we can walk around. He was definitely correct. We entered the hotel and the man at the desk was so nice, even when I tried to try a little French in which, he spoke English which was very helpful as well. There is always someone there at the front 24 hours and each one of them was very helpful and extremely nice. You also had to leave your key each time you left the hotel which wasn't really a problem. The hotel is located about 2 min. away from St. Paul metro and surrounding areas include cafes, supermarket, a little department store, and other little stores. The metro was easily accessible to the rest of the city. Also, Notre Dame was about a 10 min. walk away which was nice because there were little touristy stores in that area to buy souvenirs. Breakfast was good. We received 2 baguettes, 2 chocolate croissants, 2 croissants, orange juice and a choice of coffee or tea. We were also there while the reservations were going on and they compensated by allowing us to either choose if we wanted breakfast in the morning or not-which they would deduct the price of breakfast in our hotel charge. Another very important thing was that there was an ensuite bathroom. You really miss having one once you have used a shared bathroom. Also, they had Wi-Fi which only worked in the main lobby and it cost 2 euros for 24 hrs and 1 euro for an hour. Good to know if you plan on bringing your lap top. I loved the area, the people and overall had a wonderful experience. Next time I go to Paris (which will hopefully not be too long from now) I will definitely try to stay at the Hotel Jeanne d'Arc.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Marla001
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Hotel Jeanne d'Arc in early March 2008 for our 25th anniversary. It was our first trip to Paris and I had my heart set on staying on Ile St. Loius. However it was not in the budget. This hotel is a 5-8 minute walk to Ile St. Louis and Notre Dame, 15 min to the Louvre, and 10 to the Latin Quarter. If you walk behind the hotel, you are at St Catherine's Square where you'll find 7 (yes, really 7) bistros: Italian(great mussels and pizza), Basque, and French. And the best little store that specializes in all things Absinthe. The salesman was very kind and helpful. Additionally there was a plethora of shopping(clothing, jewelry, shoes, etc) two streets north of the hotel, and plenty of cafes for coffee and pain au chocolat in the morning. Don't eat the hotel breakfast if you have the choice. It's quality is inferior to what you can get on the street. and costs more. Back to the hotel. It was well heated, clean ,safe comfortable, and reasonably priced. It is 2 blocks form the Metro station. And the staff were helpful and did speak very good English. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: rosemusik
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Paris and the hotel made our trip memorable. Easily accessible restaurants, metro, supermarche, cafes and patisseries in the quaint district of Marais. The reception staff were very helpful, and their English was thankfully better than our French. Our room was clean, well heated and quite spacious. The bathroom was well equipped. Breakfast costs an extra 6 euro, consisting of chocolate crossaints, baguette & a selection of jams, and coffee or hot chocolate. This was good when we were having a relaxing morning and wanted to enjoy a slow start to our day. Be aware that the stairs are quite narrow and uneven at places. The lift is only big enough to fit 1 person + luggage only. We booked directly with the hotel via email, along with fax confirmation for credit card details. This was efficient without any problems. Overall, excellent value- we'd definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good service, hotel makeover”
Reviews.Author: UBK1
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, good service and right next to Rue Rivoli, St. Pauls. Stayed for 4 nights in room 60 - top floor. Nice wiev and no street noise. The hotel is right now undergoing a room makeover on all floors. The work was going on during our stay, but no problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “hall & reception great”
Reviews.Author: flisted
Reviews.Content: Hi We were 7 girls from Liverpool out to paint Paris red, booked this hotel on recommendation, thru ParisHotels.com. Who never told us that we would have to confirm with the hotel once the reservation was made. Arrived last Saturday morning to be told they did not have our booking. Although the girl who booked it had confirmation email from ParisHotels.com complete with number. The hall and reception were great the room for your meals looked great, the lady on reception could not have done anymore,( she phoned another hotel and got us 3 rooms.) BUT would advice that you confirm with the hotel if you book thru a third party. Weekend was great although it got off to a bad start.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: canadians009
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel in a great location. We would definitely stay at this hotel again and recommend it to friends. Room was comfortable and spacious enough. Hotel is located close to many attractions and great cafes and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: guillaume51
Reviews.Content: Small room, narrow staircase, tiny lift--so what? This is the Marais, not downtown Des Moines, so don't expect the Holiday Inn. Hotel Jeanne d'Arc was lovely and our room very quiet. Mattress was firm and the breakfast, standard Parisian fare, good for what it was (coffee quite strong). The hotel's location is superb: the Place des Vosges is a block away, while a ten minute walk takes you to the Ile de la cite or the Musee Picaso. We found the hotel staff warm and helpful. Behind the hotel, we enjoyed excellent meals in the restaurants of the Place du Marche-Ste-Catherine.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Brisbanetraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely, the front desk staff speak sufficient English to be of help when you need them, if you choose to have breakfast you can have it brought to your room, they do have an elevator if you're above the 1st floor. As you head out of the hotel, to your left is a lovely square (cut through here to get to the metro station) which has restaurants all around it - all very good, we ate in quite a few of them. The Marais district is a very traditional Parisian suburb, but very well located for tourists as well so you get the best of both worlds. Book as far in advance as you possibly can or you'll be disappointed. For Paris accommodation the rooms are of a good size. I would definetly stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “So Cute!”
Reviews.Author: foreard
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the second half of our Paris trip. The location is perfect - so beautiful, and in the center of everything - really ideal for romantic or short stays, for those of you who really want to feel like you are in PARIS. The price was right. I wish we had gotten it for the whole stay! Negatives: after our other hotel, the room and bed seemed a bit small, but we really didn't care. The showerhead is handheld, which does take some getting used to - and when we booked, we were told the room came w/ a hair dryer, but there wasn't (for those of you with long hair coming in winter). It is a very simple hotel, not fridge, nothing to make hot water with (well, they don't want you eating in the room, so it figures, I guess). The staff was very accomodating. Get croissants at Paul's on Rue Rivoli, very near by. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: got2travel_7
Reviews.Content: Great location in the charming Marais district, steps from shops, restaurants, cafes, metro. We even walked to Notre Dame, Louvre, Seine from the hotel. Only thing to watch is the irregular staircase, we (and many others) took a tumble so hold on tight to the handrail -- or use the teeny tiny elevator (accommodates 2 people with NO luggage).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!!”
Reviews.Author: VanessaL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from October 20-27, 2007 and LOVED IT!! We had room 20 on the front. HUGE room by Paris standards, large bathroom. The front desk staff was wonderful and very friendly from the minute we checked in. And were very patient as we attempted to communicate in French. They were very accomodating with our requests. Few things about the room, the windows open but if you are on the front as we were you hear the trash truck each AM about 7. It was no biggie, we'd simply get up and close the window ; ) The room itself was done in bright yellows and oranges and was very "spring-like" in appearance (very cheery). The bathroom had a tub with shower and was very big. The sign on the front desk says that wireless hi-speed internet is only available on the ground floor (the lobby is on the ground floor, one floor up, the 1st floor is where the rooms start, we were on the 2nd floor (3rd by US standards). However, we were able to get the internet in our room without difficulty and at 10euros for the whole week, was definitely worth it (considering that Hiltons and Hyatts charge $10 a day, I was ok with about $15US for the week). We had the breakfast twice (6euros each) and included a croissant, a pain du chocolat, a baguette, butter, jam, coffee or hot chocolate. It was yummy and the days we used it (first full morning in Paris and last full morning in Paris) were very convenient. There are tons of patisseries and boulangeries in the area, though the prices were about equal for the same amount of food. The location is INSANE!!! It is near a zillion restaurants, wine stores, chocolate stores, and the neighorhood is beyond fabulous!! The St. Paul Metro is 3 blocks away. Buy having now stayed in the Marais twice, I have decided that I am not going to ever stay in another area, this seems like it gives you the most realistic Paris experience without being overly touristy. I highly recommend this hotel. Please don't bother if you are a Hotel Crillion type, but if you love quaint, friendly, cozy rooms for a GREAT price, give them a try, you won't be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: synnog
Reviews.Content: Stayed here may 2006 - a nice hotel with a nice staff. The room wasn't exactly big, and the linnen was in a "sorry" state. Clean, but with holes and realy worn out. This could be much better. The shower gave us som work - low pressure - varying temp. etc. but this is how it is at budget hotels in France There were no way to hang things in the bathroom this could also be improved. BUT, as we preferred to have brekfast in our room - as was offered - the nice staff carried the breakfast to us every morning - with a smile - and no extra costs - and this was of course rewarded. A luxurious feeling in a budget hotel. This is the fifth time I've stayed at a budget hotel in Marais - and this was the best - and we're planning to stay there again next year. The location is perfect - not to much noise, in walking distance of a lot of attractions and not far from the Metro of the trainstation. We higly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Right price, right location”
Reviews.Author: Mark_SF
Reviews.Content: To echo what's been written before....you will not find a better value in the Marais. While the rooms are spartan and a tad threadbare, the location and price is what sets this gem apart. If you're looking for a hotel in a great walking district of Paris, close by all the sights, you need to consider this place. If you're looking for luxury and not concerned with price, go to the Park Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler012
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a wonderful holiday in Paris. We loved the Hotel Jeanne D'Arc. Our room (02) and our sons' room (53) were both very spacious, clean and comfortable. Even though there was noise from the street in our room since it is on the first floor, it was Paris noise and did not bother us a bit. It was very cool when we were there, in the high 50s at night, so we did not have a problem with the heat. The location is perfect with the Place des Vosges nearby and a charming square just around the corner. We would recommend this lovely hotel to one and all. It is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Good value”
Reviews.Author: gippa
Reviews.Content: Like previous reviews have said, this hotel is in an excellent location for nightlife and sightseeing. Just round the corner is a small square with 6-7 restaurants with outdoor seating and has a lovley peaceful setting. The price of this hotel makes it great value for money, however I would say that if you are planning to stay for more than 2 nights then request a room with a street view which would give off more light. We did not have breakfast as we wanted to make use of the many cafes Paris has to offer. I would definatly recommend this hotel, and the staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTOtraveller
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel and would highly recommend this hotel. You can't beat the location for proximity to the Metro and fun bars and shops in the Marais district. The hotel is very well decorated and the rooms are clean and quiet nice. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The only drawback is that this hotel does not have air conditioning and if you are sleeping with the windows open you can hear some of the street noise (though the hotel is located on a generally quiet street). We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Neighborhood, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: flygurl814
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here April 23-25th. We absolutely loved the location of this hotel - Marais was a great neighborhood and the metro stop was very close by. Other than that, the hotel was very reasonably priced for what we got. The room was fairly spacious (for Europe) and always clean. On the down side, there were a few small problems with the room. The bathroom door didn't shut, and the shower head wouldn't stay up so you had to hold it. We did not get breakfast because we thought it was a rip off at 6 euros. Instead we walked down the street to Hilarie Boulangerie Patasserie for DELICIOUS croissiants and apple tarts (something "aux pommes") for less than 2 euros a piece. I'd stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat for it's suberb location and extremely reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable”
Reviews.Author: Zeldazoss
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the hotel from April 1-April 5, 2007. We enjoyed this cute little place. Unfortunately, our room was rather noisy, room #1. It was right next to the dining room and the street noise. However, we liked that it was so convenient. We had just stayed in London on a 4th floor walk up. The room was very cute, though smelled a bit musty. The bathroom was updated and clean. The staff was very friendly and the neighborhood is wonderful. I love the Marais. I stayed in the Latin quarter the last time I went to Paris, which was also great, but I prefer the Marais. There are at least 30 restauraunts within a 2 block radius, the St Paul Metro is 2 short blocks away, and the Musee de Carnavalet is around the corner. The Place des Vosges is about 3 blocks away, St Paul church is a block away, and the Picasso Musee is also in short walking distance. There were too many cafes, bars, boulangeries, and patisseries to count; and plenty of shopping. I wish I could go to Paris again next week, but of course, it will probably be a few years until we can splurge for a European trip. I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: Jerry_Bank
Reviews.Content: We stayed for eight nights. The location was perfect, the room (#52) very nice and the staff was friendly and helpful. Book early if you want to come. We couldn't get the April stay we wanted when we tried in October. Note that there is another Jeanne d'Arc in Paris. This is the one in the Marais.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: jlhcorley
Reviews.Content: Grand Hotel Jeanne d'Arc had a friendly staff and a decently priced breakfast. However, I didn't think our room, number 55, was anything to write home about. The wallpaper was peeling at the bottom, the carpet was worn, and the bathroom shower was a small stall with a plastic curtain. The price was right for such a room at 85 euros, but if I hadn't gone on rave reviews and searched a little harder, I might have found a less worn hotel for the same price. Perhaps our room was just an exception. The location was fantastic, and if you don't mind feeling guilty for eating or drinking in your hotel room (no picnicking is proclaimed in several different places), I would suggest this hotel but ask to see the room first.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Candid_Canuck
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the recommendation of my cousin, who had lived in Paris for several years in the '90s. I wanted a clean, safe, and well-located hotel for a week-long holiday with my 18-year-old daughter--and I didn't want to pay a fortune since I knew we wouldn't be spending that much time in the room anyway. He told me he'd "recommend the Jeanne d'Arc to royalty", and while I wouldn't necessarily go that far, I would certainly recommend it to sophisticated, budget-minded travelers. We paid 97 Euros a night (an excellent price for this excellent Marais location) for #22, a large room with a double and a single bed and a large bathroom with a shower and tub. The best way I can describe the decor is to say that it's as if the hotel owner went down to the local DIY store and bought wallpaper and chintz fabric and did the job himself. It was a tad kitschy but very cozy--like staying in the guest room at a beloved aunt's house. It's a quirky place: the rooms are all different; the stairs are uneven; the elevator is like stepping into a coffin; the shower water turns scalding when the person in the next room flushes the toilet. But you know, it's also a really charming place: the breakfast and housekeeping staff greeted us warmly every day; the desk staff were professional and indulgent of our atrocious French; the continental breakfast was fairly priced, ample and delicious. (My daughter, who has travelled frequently with me over the years, pointed out how much she liked the fact that the hotel wasn't "a cookie-cutter hotel" like many of the four- and five-star business hotels we have stayed at together. "This hotel could only be this hotel," is how she put it.) The hotel is in an upscale residential district, so you get a sense of living in a real Paris neighborhood--not smack in the middle of touristland. There are great cheese and meat shops and bakeries and fruitstands everywhere. The St. Paul Metro stop is a block and a half away, and is right on the main line that takes you to all the tourist sites. But mostly we just walked everywhere. It's definitely noisy in the morning when the garbage trucks roll around the neighborhood, and during the evening rush hour, so I recommend earplugs if you're sensitive to noise. Both my daughter and I used them every night. Trust me, I looked around a lot and you will not find a better price on a hotel of the same quality and location, so book directly with the hotel as soon as you have confirmed dates. Don't rely on the resellers, because a lot of them told me the place was full on my dates, but when I contacted the hotel directly, they had space for us for 7 nights. If you want the Georges V, this ain't it. But if you want clean, affordable, friendly and well-located, you'll really like this place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our room”
Reviews.Author: MavenNyc
Reviews.Content: We had originally booked at another hotel in the Marais that was around the same price, but lasted only one night there (Hotel de 7e Art) because the beds were for midgets -- seriously -- my friend is only 5 feet and thin and she felt squeezed. The next morning, we checked out Jeanne de Arc and felt lucky that one of their nicest rooms -- 63 -- was available. It had two comfortable double beds and what has to be the biggest bathroom for a reasonably priced hotel room in the center of Paris. I will note that a friend from London booked a single room on the third floor and his room was tiny. Moving to this hotel saved the trip since we were both very disappointed with the other room. My one qualm was that it was easy to smell cigarette smoke from other rooms, but that's Paris. For the money and the location in the heart of great shopping (which is what we came to Paris to do, since the famous winter soldes were taking place) the Jeanne de Arc was hard to beat. We could have stayed at a fancier place, but that would have left less money to buy shoes!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but....”
Reviews.Author: KeithLafayette
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights over a weekend in November 2006. I have been to Paris a few times and always seemed to book too late to get a reservation here. After reading for years the raves this hotel has gotten, I was very interested to what the fuss was all about. The hotel was easy to find and checkin went fine. The woman behind the desk was very nice and welcoming (unlike some guy who was at the desk at times during my stay). I was given a double for one person on the 4th floor. The elevator, as many have mentioned, was very small and sometimes took so long I just took the stairs. Although my room was a nice size, it has seen better days. The carpet, linens and paint were all a little worn looking. The bathroom was a good size and clean, but the towels were about the thinnest I have ever seen in a hotel. The bed was decent and I was able to sleep well. The location of the hotel is real plus...just a short walk from the heart of the Marais with plenty of restaurants, bars and clubs. All in all, I have somewhat mixed feelings about this hotel. If one is on a very tight budget and cannot spring for another 20 or 30 euros, the Jeanne d'Arc should do you fine. But when I return to Paris this summer, I am opting to spend 25 euros more for a different hotel in the area that I have stayed at before.

Reviews.Title: “want to repeat experience”
Reviews.Author: KathleenOrangeCounty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this exceptional hotel for 6 nights in mid October 2006. This was my third trip to Paris and have not visited the Marais before. Far cry from the touristy areas we were accustomed to. Lovely staff each and every day. I agree with others that the noise can be a bother but a simple closing of windows works. Speeding motor cycles seems to be the norm in the wee hours of the morning. We found the restuarants to be great! I found the cassoulette to be remarkable in the cafe closest to the hotel. Two left turns and you are there. (can't recall the name) All cafes post menus at the entrance..... Breakfast was very good, convenient and price is right. As for electricity and you hair appliances......... your french adapters are useless without voltage converters.... Howerver my converter did not fit wall socket (mine was flush and theirs was concave). We had to buy these appliances at Monoprix. (Like our Target) Very pricey for the least expensive but we had no choice. Only worth the purchase if you will use again. We met other Americans at this hotel who visit every year and would not dream of staying elsewhere. I'm inclined to agree. My only complaint is no hair dryers in rooms.......... this would be a much desired addition. (We saw a lot of wet heads in the breakfast room) Clean hotel with HOT water and comfortable beds. And the best part.... no surprise charges at check out. Very straight forward billing. Stefhan was very helpful in calling for taxi to take us to Gare De Lyon. We arrived in plenty of time. Just remember the cost in taxi meter does not cover luggage. Usual cost is 1 euro per piece. So although we thought we had enough for the ride ..we ended up digging for more euro for bags and tip. I'm saving for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Aloha5
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay at Hotel Jeanne d'Arc. I can't say enough about this hotel. The staff were always helpful going above and beyond (they helped my friend find a cheaper shuttle to CDG, even offering to cancel her original shuttle) and they spoke great English. The location was great....15 min. walk to Notre Dame. The Marais area is full of clothing/home boutiques, wonderful restaurants, grocery store, and even a SNCF boutique (train tickets). You're right next to Place de Vosges, Place du Catherine, and the #1 Metro line. Due to the great local, you will hear garbage trucks in the morning from the outside rooms. It was a small sacrifice for a top floor, corner room! Our bed was firm and our room was much larger than expected. I will always return to this hotel! You can't beat the price (84E for double). Book way in advance and contact the hotel directly!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Wondeful location. Great value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: wanderlusting2
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at grander hotels, but fewer in better locations. The Marais is close to everything you want to see in Paris and more. I walked only 10 minutes to the Ile de la Cite and Notre Dame, and to the Ile St. Louis and its charming neighborhood. You are also very close to an Internet Cafe, if you are addicted to email, like I am. Breakfast is not included. But it is a decent value at six euros (I priced other breakfasts in the neighborhood) with generous servings of coffee, orange juice, and a basket of breakfast breads. The front desk staff is friendly and efficient, and they speak good English. Memorize some key words for the maids and serving staff, as they seem to speak only French. The uneven stairs are not for the faint of heart, however I had no trouble using the tiny elevator. Our room was spare but clean (see photos) and the bathroom of adequate size. Definitely bring your own toiletries, as they supplied no shampoo. I had hoped for a hair dryer, but found none. I also brought my own wash cloth. Also, if you are not accustomed to city living, the area may seem loud. So bring ear plugs if you don't like the sound of pedestrians laughing or the garbage trucks in early morning. A friend who was staying in a place in the Left Bank said her hotel cost twice as much for a much smaller room. Another friend, who recommended a hotel on the Ile St. Louis, also had a cramped space. If you are interested in booking this hotel, reserve your room early. I spoke to a woman who stays at this hotel every year. She books a year ahead of time and even then she's sometimes not successful. We booked in January to get a room in September. Location: The hotel is around the corner from a charming square with about 4-5 restaurants. The Museum of Paris, the Picasso Museum, Place des Voghes, the Bastile, and Georges Pompidou Center are also very close. The St. Paul metro is only a five minute walk (at most), and we were so near the left bank, Louvre, and the banks of the Seine, that we managed to walk to most of these places. I gave this room four stars because of the location, otherwise I would have given it three.

Reviews.Title: “A FAMILY'S TALE”
Reviews.Author: cazzelli
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four.....2 adults with our daughters aged 12 and 9. Our room on the 1st floor was clean (as was the rest of the hotel ) and functional with a good bathroom. The staff were pleasant and helpful and quite happy to put up with our fairly bad french! There's a bookcase in reception with tons of info for reference, and an amazing amount of free leaflets about paris to choose from. The breakfasts were of the usual high standard to be found in paris....and the lady who served them was happy to oblige individual tastes regarding drinks...etc we found this hotel to be absolutely ideal as a base for 'doing' paris as a family, and the area itself is fantastic ; vibrant, varied, and authentic. we so enjoyed our stay we are going to book up there again for next year,,,this time for a longer period. The only thing I would add is this.....real life goes on here and if you are looking for absolute peace and quiet this might not be the right area. It's not excessively noisy, but neither is it a backwater! But if you want energy and authenticity this is the place to go. We drove to and around France, and Paris has the usual parking problems of any great city. We left our car in a secure car-park for the whole of our 4 night stay, and it cost 23 euro a day! So be warned if you are driving! There's a huge variety of shops; bakeries, restaurants, supermarkets, cafes, galleries, tabacs, boutiques, retro clothes-shops, bookshops, very original gift shops, creperies, patisseries etc etc. The local population communities include, a muslim quarter, a jewish quarter and a thriving gay community. I found it to be an unselfconcious, pleasant and busy area and as a family we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “I Really Like This Place!”
Reviews.Author: Bambi_Boulangerie
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Jeanne d'Arc is in a great location in the Marais; close to the Musee Picasso, Musee Carnavalet and the Place des Vosges, as well as tons of great shopping. The nearest metro stop is St. Paul. The room was very small, as was the bathroom, but neat and clean. My room overlooked rue de Jarente. The water pressure in the bathroom was good and there was plenty of hot water. Though the room had a TV & telephone, there was no mini bar. Also, they request that their guests not picnic in their rooms. The staff was quite helpful with directions, particularly when the streets were not on the map! The maids were particularly friendly and cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little gem”
Reviews.Author: hardbati
Reviews.Content: [------------] We loved this cute little hotel. GREAT area! It was a wonderful location with so many cute bakeries, shops, grocery stores and deli's close by. We walked all over the city and this was by far the best area. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Economical Choice for Paris”
Reviews.Author: traveler07Usa
Reviews.Content: I'll add my praise to the other reviews for Jeanne d'Arc. My husband and I stayed there for 3 nights and liked the same things about it that others have mentioned, but I would add charming, at least for our room. The decor has a whimsical quality which we love. Our room (#2) was on the ground floor, and although it was close to the noise of the alleys and the cafes at night, we really appreciated the convenience of no stairs to climb or elevator to wait for after a hard day of shopping and sightseeing. Both the room and bathroom seemed enormous to us, but that could be because we'd stayed the night before in an Ibis in Beaune--now that's small! They had a fan in the room (which also blocked the street noise) and the weather wasn't hot while we were there, so we didn't miss air-conditioning, the temperature and water pressure of the shower were great. There are certainly tons of restaurants, bars, cafes, and brasseries to choose from in the neighborhood, but I have to agree with a previous poster that the food we had at least was fine but not wonderful. The reception guy recommended Bofinger, which is also in Michelin, so we gave it a try, and while we enjoyed the atmosphere, our food was so-so and expensive. A lot of other diners were having the seafood platters, so maybe that's the thing to order...Anyway, we enjoyed this hotel and the Marais, and if we go to Paris again will definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A delightful hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: 5kingfishers
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel ! Being my first trip to Paris I wasn't sure what to expect as far as hotel standards go. The Hotel Jeanne d'Arc was delightful. The management were always friendly and were able to extend my stay an extra night at late notice, much to my relief. The hotel is in a great location, close to the St Paul metro stop, so an easy walk with luggage, and in an area full of little eateries and quaint shops. I stayed 3 nights in room #31, which is a small single and at EUR58 particularly good value. Yes it was compact, but the bed was a double pushed against the wall, so more than I had expected. It was comfortable and I suspect this was a recently redecorated room from what other reviewers have mentioned. The presentation was outstanding - clean, no smell, a huge window that opens on to the street, basic furnishings in the way of a desk, cupboard and tv. Tiny bathroom. Literally tiny. But then what more do you really need. As a single woman traveling on my own, I felt this to be a safe neighbourhood. I had the EUR6 breakfast each morning and thought it to be good value. The hotel has a small, light-filled breakfast room sitting perhaps a dozen guests. Your choice of tea/coffee/hot chocolate is served up with a spare milk jug, so enough to make at least a couple of cups, plus half baguette, mini croissant and a second mini chocolate crossiant. Delicious French butter and individual serve of jam are included. Yes you can probably buy cheaper by going direct to the bakery, but for the quiet and convenience I liked the hotel breakfast. It gives you a chance to plan your day. Another benefit is that this breakfast can be delivered to your room at no additional charge. I would not hesitate to stay at the Hotel Jeanne d'Arc and can't wait to make my second visit to Paris. Remember to book well in advance or you'll miss out on this gem. The staff were helpful and friendly, even though I could speak no more than a few words in French. There's an internet cafe within 5-10 minutes walk, also a self-service laundromat a couple of blocks away. I'd also recomment the Place des Vosges for a picnic - plently of locals love this park and you'll see it filled with kids and dogs. This hotel made my trip to Paris special.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Jeanne D'Arc”
Reviews.Author: nzm76
Reviews.Content: I had researched hotels in Paris (and which areas to stay in) for quite a while before a much anticipated trip in May 2006. I booked this hotel 3 -4 weeks before I was due to arrive there with my husband for a 4 night stay at the beginning of May 2006. I didn't know what to expect because there hadn't been any reviews in Trip advisor and so I based my decision on a brief review in a guide book. I booked a twin room (which was all that was available) but asked for a double if one became available - by the time we arrived they had remembered my request without any mention of it by me and we were put in a double without any problem at all (which is great service in my book)! My husband and I were very happy with this hotel and would definitely recommend it. Although the room was small (most European hotel rooms are small), it was not tiny and it was clean and comfortable and had enough room for bedside tables, a closet and a table and chair. The bathroom was quite roomy, clean and worked well although I thought it could use some new towels (they felt thin and scratchy). I loved the breakfast of breads and croissants and pastries with jams and the hot chocolate was delicious!!! The hotel reception was great because they spoke English, lent us books on Paris and gave us a great recommendation for dinner (Le Impasse was truly a gastronomic experience without the huge price tag)! We also loved the quaint area around the hotel (small streets, interesting shops and things to look at everywhere you turn) and the Marais was just so fantastic for food (the pastries near the train station are excellent) and there was a great train line very close to the hotel which helped us get around (although we were able to walk to a lot of places from the hotel such as Notre Dame, Ste Chappelle etc). All in all, I'd highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again if I'm lucky enough to go to Paris again soon (sigh)!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: jjmarkp
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Paris. I stayed there for a week at the end of May 2006. I'm rating this above average (even though I'm not sure what average really is for Paris) simply because I would stay there there again without hestiation. Echoing some of the comments already posted: GREAT location; very clean but basic rooms (mine was renovated and had a shower); a firm, comfortable bed; lots of light from the large windows (and refreshing cross breezes since we had a corner room). The hotel can be a bit noisy...doors tend to slam and you can hear a good amount of street noise...(there was a party until 2am in the building next door that was annoying the first night.) The staff was helpful, but, not overly friendly. I didn't try the breakfast. I would stay here again if I decided to make the Marais my Paris travel base.

Reviews.Title: “Decent , Good Value But Has Noise Issues”
Reviews.Author: GBay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in the fashionable Marais area on a quiet street ,very close to the subway. The price is good and the hotel is decent. Staff speaks good English, professional though somewhat aloof. I would say the hotel is decent but I am not as enthusiastic as the other reviewers. My husband and I stayed twice in this hotel in 1 month. Our first room was an unrenovated room on the 4th floor which looked tired . Despite being on a quiet street, the windows were not soundproof so we could hear street cleaning machines and garbage collection when they come by. So if you are a light sleeper, you should be aware of this. The 2nd room we stayed in was on the ground floor ( street outside window), but renovated ,so it was much more cheerful and welcoming.The bathroom was large with very good water pressure. But the room was close to the kitchen and a small sitting area and we could hear the staff talking in the morning. Again the windows were not soundproof therefore we heard garbage collection noise on weekend mornings. In summary, the hotel is good value for the price and location, but if you are a light sleeper, you should be prepared for the city and staff noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Good Value”
Reviews.Author: matarsakzendeh
Reviews.Content: I am rating this hotel ABOVE AVERAGE - FOR PARIS. In the U.S. they would not be in business, but this is true of most two star Paris hotels. For Paris, this place is mostly great: A nice, pleasant clean hotel located a block off a major street in the Marais, the Faobourg St. Antoine - not exactly charming, but very functional. It is about four to five blocks from the St. Paul Metro, which is on the convenient #1 line. The hotel is very clean but very basic. For its price range, it’s one of the best hotels you will find in the Marais – and in Paris in general. This is a great location and very central to everything. If you don’t go with too many expectations, or if you are used to other budget hotels in Paris, you will find this a pleasant place to stay. Having said that, please read on to see some of the issues that may matter to some folks. The rooms are small but typical of Paris. The mattresses are very very firm – so depending on what you are used to, this could be an issue for some. The hotel walls are thin, so if you have noisy neighbors you may hear them. We certain heard the flushing in the room next door very loudly. Note that these are all things you expect in small Paris hotels. You do not have any control over the temperature in your room, and everything is very basic. A bed, a TV which does get CNN and BBC, a table and chair are about it. The only problem we had was with the bathroom, which as is the case in many hotels in Paris, did not have a shower – only a tub. The tub was under the attic slanted roof, so one could not stand in it either. Without a shower curtain and no room to stand, bathing was very difficult using the hand held water hose. Although this is typical in much of Paris, most hotels now do have the showers in many rooms as an option. The towels in this hotel are torn and worn and tiny. This is an area that definitely warrants improvement. The breakfast is definitely not worth it, considering the lovely food you can buy at any café in the area. My recommendation is in the mornings to walk or take the metro to the Place Aligre market, which is simply wonderful. On Sunday mornings, the market at Richard Lenoir, right off Bastille is fabulous for both lunch and breakfast. You can also buy gifts such as great quality foie gras (and don’t start me on the cheese options!)- there are over a hundred stands selling many different kinds of food, and all of it the very best of Paris. Skip the restaurants. I really do find that its very hard to get great food eating out in Paris – compared to the quality of food you can buy at these markets. Even with a lot of research, multiple books on Paris Bistros, and reading recommendations from many locals and travelers, we were still unimpressed with virtually every mean in Paris except the fresh food we bought in markets. If you want to try some restaurants close to the hotel, the Brasserie Bofinger and a few other famed eateries are on the way from the hotel to the Bastille- just a short walk away. We ate at Chez Paul, based on many recommendations in numerous Paris Bistro books (and later found it featured in Samantha Brown’s travels as well ) - it is also a short walk on the other side of Bastille. We found it adequate, but hardly something as exceptional as we were led to believe. The very best food we had in the area close to the hotel was at a place called Camille’s just a few blocks away in the heart of the Marais. The Place the Vosages was very close to the hotel and has some nice places for coffee and croissants on it. You can walk in minutes to Victor Hugo’s house and the lovely Picasso Museum is also a very short walk away. Altogether, the location of the hotel is fantastic and for Paris it’s a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “shower trouble”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with this hotel overall and it was good value. I was very disappointed however with the response I received when I complained that the shower attachment in my room was broken and that I wanted it replaced (so that I could have a proper shower) or move to another room. Instead of an apology I was told that all the attachments in the whole hotel were broken! I subsequently proved this to be untrue, but still received no apology. Even the manager the next day offered no apology, telling me that all the bathrooms had one thing or another wrong with them and giving me the impression that they didn't really care as they were full every night.

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply, great value!!!”
Reviews.Author: IrishRovr
Reviews.Content: Un très bon rapport qualité-prix, as the French would say. I have stayed at the Jeanne d'Arc many times over the past fifteen years or so, and have never been disappointed. It is always my first choice when I am visiting Paris. True, the rooms do vary a bit in size, though every room I have been given has been at least adequate. True, there are some odd decor choices. True, the bathrooms do not meet international luxury hotel standards, but they are clean, functional, and well maintained in my experience. I have always found the rooms comfortable, clean and, yes, charming, in a slightly idiosyncratic way. The hotel's location is outstanding! I love being able to walk a block or so to a choice of excellent cafes for breakfast. (Yes, the hotel breakfast is very good, considering the price, but I prefer a little more Paris with my morning café-crême.) The neighborhood shops can supply almost anything you might want, from picnic supplies to fine art or high fashion. You can walk to most places you want to go, and you have good bus and métro options (including the Bastille station) if you are wandering a bit farther. And there are many places well worth visiting - including several excellent museums – within a quarter mile or so. It would be hard to beat the selection of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel – everything from the simple, honest little neighborhood bistro, to the finest cuisine in a luxury setting, and with a matching range of prices. Parisian, regional French, Jewish, Corsican, Italian, Japanese and more – a huge variety. I have ALWAYS found the staff to be friendly, polite, helpful and good-humored. On one occasion we arrived late, around 8:00pm on a Friday evening, and very tired after a horrible weather-delayed trip. I tried to get a table at the Auberge de Jarente (warm, friendly, good hearty Basque food – highly recommended), only a few yards from the hotel, but was told they were fully booked. When I mentioned this casually to the receptionist, she called the restaurant and, using more Parisian charm than I could have believed possible (and I do find Parisians charming, especially the women!) persuaded the patron to find us a cozy little corner table, with only a half hour wait – and an apéritif and "amuse-bouche" on the house while we waited! The only downside is that the hotel is, deservedly, immensely popular, and often is fully booked months in advance. This has made it necessary for me to stay on different occasions at three other hotels nearby, all of which cost more, and all of which pleased me less. So book early, but if you want cookie-cutter soul-less functionality, this might not be the place for you. For everyone else, thank your lucky stars that there are still a few places like this left in Paris where value for your Euro combines with friendly staff and a great location. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “On the rue Jarente, number 3”
Reviews.Author: LifeofReiley
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from France and spent four nights at the Hotel Jeanne d'Arc at 3 rue de Jarente, and we loved the hotel. First, the hotel is spotlessly clean. We were in Paris two weekends, so had two different rooms. Both rooms were spotless, with clean sheets, and no odd odors. While the rooms and bathrooms are small, its to be expected for such a great location in Paris, and for the low price. We paid 80Euros per night for the two us. Breakfast was an extra 6Euros, but worth the price compared with the local cafes (of course, with the "street" ambiance). Our room on the first weekend was on the 2nd floor, and over the street, so somewhat noisy, but it wasn't enough to interfere with our sleep. On the 2nd weekend, our window overlooked the central air shaft for the building...no view, but the smells were incredible coming from a restaurant below. Second, the location is really wonderful, just around the corner from a small square with several restaurants. We found the Bar de Jarente to particularly good, and ate there several times. Patrick, who managed the restaurant, is wonderful, and the food was excellent. Additionally, its very close to the St. Paul Metro line, which makes it very easy to get around Paris. But, within a few blocks, you are on the Ile St. Louis...we walked just about everywhere. Third, the people working at the Jeanne d'Arc were all very nice, and friendly. We'll be sure to stay again at the Jeanne d'Arc...only difference is that we'll pack lighter, and catch the RER from CDG right to the hotel, and walk the few blocks to the hotel. Couldn't be any easier.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Paul750
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights in February 2005. A pleasant small hotel in a quiet side street right in the heart of the Marais, next to the Place De Vosges, 100m from St Paul Metro, numerous good quality restaurants and bars 2 minutes walk away and plenty of small independant shops and boutiques for my wife to browse through! OK some of the rooms can be small but they are what you pay for in a 2* Paris hotel. We were on the attic floor - room 60. Cosy and comfortable. Don't let your expectations be too high. Comfortable - not grand, friendly staff - not subservient, Perfect location. Will certainly stay again. This is a judgement based on staying in at least 4 other similarly priced hotels in Paris over the last few years.

Reviews.Title: “Yes and No”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading all the contradictory reviews of this hotel, I wanted to weigh in. The location is absolutely perfect. I prefer staying in the Marais, but it can be noisy, so this small street off a pedestrian square really can't be topped. The public rooms of the hotel, while certainly not luxurious, are pleasant and cheerful. My room (a two-bedded room for two people) was disappointing. It needed a paint job, the drapes and bedspread were really cheesy, as was the furniture, and the carpet seemed grimy. The bathroom was minimal, and the water temp fluctuated making showers dangerous. The overall effect was a bit depressing. As my stay continued, I was less bothered by all this, and I must say that the small bill at the end of my stay felt like a bonus. But I still have fond memories of the week I spent at the nearby Hotel de la Bretonnerie, which felt like a cozy welcoming home. It is on a noisier street and it is about 45 euros more a night, but I think next time I might opt for it rather than the Jeanne d'Arc.

Reviews.Title: “Personal, near everything”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in January 2005 and was satisfied with nearly everyting. Location very good, good service. Clean and cheap. The shower was a bit small in my room ( a single) and the breakfast is not what I call a breakfast but otherwise a very recommondable hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the Marais - Awesome location!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a good, basic and clean hotel in Paris for a reasonable cost. A tall order I know... but I knew that I would be spending very little time in the hotel and that a good location was key. The Jeanne d'Arc exceeded my expectations. I had a clean room with plenty of towels -- the room size and bathroom size was more than adequate. It was basic, but the location was fantastic! Paris is a large city, so be sure to watch your personal belongings -- just like you would in NYC -- and you'll be fine. I'd stay at the Jeanne d'Arc again -- the location can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Not so great...”
Reviews.Author: valleyankee
Reviews.Content: I selected the Jeanne d'Arc knowing that it ws one of the cheapest hotels in the Marais which also get good reviews. Who is reviewing this place? The lobby of the hotel consists of a number of rooms including a reception, a breakfast room and a sitting room. They also have a luggage room in case you need to store you bag as you wait for a later departure. The reception area is decorated with a huge funky mirror that is as original as it is artistic. This is where the originality of the hotel begins and this is where it ends. Now the rooms... When I checked in I found I was given a room with a bath only but no shower, although I requested a room with a shower. The room was on the 6th floor and had a nice view over the rooftops of Paris. It was also one of the biggest rooms I have ever had in this price range. The room was decorated with mix and match furniture and an open style closet. It really felt like a attic dorm room. The colors were in shades of orange and yellow, I think the carpet was blue. After using the room for a bit I went down to see if I could get a room with a shower. The girl at the front desk asked me, “did you use the toilet?”, well that's a bit too personal. Basically because I used the facilities she would not move me because I guess the room would have had to be sanitized. She promised me a room with a bath the next day. On the second day I was moved to a new room which was on the 2nd floor. The room was a lot smaller but it did have a large bathroom and a nice big stand up shower. It was nice to be on the second floor because I could use the stairs to get to my room rather than the slow elevator. The room was decorated in the same shades or orange and yellow but had different furniture including an armour and a desk. Here are my overall notes- 1. The room did not smell very good. Later I when I sat on the floor to put on my shoe I realized it was coming from the carpet. Which smelled fowl. The whole room smelled like "dirty old man". 2. Sheets on the bed were paper thin and scratchy. 3. If someone was smoking in a room around you, you will smell it. This was particularry gross at 7am in the morning. 4. If someone was showering in a room next to you you will hear it very clearly. 5. The beds were low to the ground and not comfortable. 6. The bathroom towels were grey and dingy and so worn that they were scratchy and not absorbant. Washcloths are not provided (as they aren't in many European hotels). When traveling in Europe, I always bring my own and discard them on departure. Oddly enough the bathroom did have a heated towel bar which came in handy when I needed to dry some stuff I washed in the sink! 7. While taking a shower you are either scalded or frozen everytime someone flushes a toilet or runs water. Water pressure was good though. 8. The location is fantastic and walkable to many of the shops, restaurants and sights in the Marais area. 9. The front desk staff can have a bit of attitude but was also helpful when necessary. 10. Personal safety and the safety of your belongings are a serious issue here. One night I returned to the hotel and there was no key to my room in the rack. They suggested I never gave it back. Oh yes, I did. The front desk clerk then gave me (yes gave me) the hotel pass key to get into my room. When I went up to my room my hotel key was in the door!!! It seems like they had to do some work in my room and the mechanic left the key in the door. The girl at the front desk admitted that she knew the key was gone when she went home the prior evening. Another night I returned to the hotel to find no clerk at the front desk. Another couple and I waited about 5 minutes but no one showed up. At that point we simply went behind the desk and helped ourself to the keys to our rooms. After I was in my room about 5 minutes, I heard some downstais calling, hello?, hello? Obvioiusly he still had not returned. The luggage room is locked but they will let you into it, unattended, to get your bag. Anyone could pop in and take anything. Truthfully, you get what you pay for. I stayed here because the value of the dollar was so bad. My room was €80 a night which was a good price for the location. Considering the safety, threadbare towels and smelly room, ity was no bargain. For an additional $20 I could have stayed at any number of respectable budget hotels, such as the Relais du Louvre or the Hotel Castex. I have stayed at both and they were both more respectable. Regardless of the good location and low price, I would pass on this hotel on future trips. It just seems like too much of a crap shoot. You never know what you will get.

Reviews.Title: “Very Charming Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last weekend with my parents who were visiting us from the U.S. This hotel is everything the reviews say and more: very nice at a non-Parisian price. The rooms are charming-French (and clean) in Provençal colors, with bathrooms up-to-date by Paris standards. I can't remember if all the reviews said the doubles rooms were small or not small, but from our growing Paris hotel experience, they are a completely acceptable size, with plenty of room for two people and a reasonable amount of luggage. The neighborhood is vibrant with activity and shops. There is almost everything a person needs very close by. We especially liked the lively little Place right outside our hotel, which has a half dozen or more restaurant choices. This October was an extremely heavy tourist/meeting month and hotel availabilities in an economical range were becoming scarce as far back as August. Hotel Jeanne D'Arc only had a 3-night duration and my parents needed 5 nights. In response to my request to add 2 nights if a cancellation occured, they actually made the effort and accommodated their full stay. Other hotels we asked wouldn't take the time to do this. This seems to be above average hotel service for smaller hotels in Paris, so we were very happy they helped us.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Jeanne d'Arc
HotelInfo.Address: 3 Rue de Jarente | 04 Arr., 75004 Paris, France
